title: Data Analyst
description: We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, reviewing, and processing prospect and client data in our corporate systems. Your primary focus will be on maintaining accurate and up-to-date information regarding client locations, values, and contact details. Additionally, you will collaborate with the Customer Service teams to ensure the timely and accurate maintenance of Building Information Modeling (BIM) for engineering updates and prospect information. This is a long term Contract role, it could go permanent depending on performance, located near Des Plaines, IL.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Collect, review, and process prospect and client data, ensuring accuracy and completeness. </li><li>Maintain up-to-date client and broker contact information, as well as document distribution instructions. </li><li>Collaborate with the Customer Service teams to ensure timely and accurate maintenance of Building Information Modeling (BIM) for engineering updates and prospect information. </li><li>Prepare certificates of insurance and proof of insurance documentation based on client and broker requests. </li><li>Adhere to documented terms and conditions, territory requirements, and company compliance standards while preparing insurance documentation. </li><li>Liaise with the Client Servicing Teams and requesters to verify the accuracy of certificates and policy information before issuance. </li><li>Issue and distribute certificates and policy information electronically or in hard copy format, following provided instructions. </li><li>Follow corporate procedures, guidelines, and governance protocols for processing insurance deliverables. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Requirements:<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Data Analytics, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related discipline. </li><li>Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role. </li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail. </li><li>Proficiency in data management and analysis tools, such as Excel, SQL, or Python. </li><li>Familiarity with Building Information Modeling (BIM) is a plus. </li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. </li><li>Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks simultaneously. </li><li>Strong organizational and time management abilities. </li><li>Join our dynamic team and contribute to our company's success by leveraging your data analysis skills to support our insurance operations. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Job Details: <br></strong><ul><li>Long term Contract, could go permanent depending on performance </li><li>Monday-Friday first shift, hybrid </li><li>Pay is $20-25 an hour depending on experience <br><br></li></ul>If you are interested, please apply and submit your resume.<br><br><strong>Benefit offerings include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits, and 401K plan. Our program provides employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. Available paid leave may include Paid Sick Leave, where required by law; any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law; and Holiday pay upon meeting eligibility criteria</strong><strong>.<br><br></strong>Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled<br><br>To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please navigate to https://www.lhh.com/us/en/candidate-privacy<br><br>The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records

title: Data Analyst
description: Inovalon was founded in 1998 on the belief that technology, and data specifically, would empower the transformation of the entire healthcare ecosystem for the better, improving both outcomes and economics. At Inovalon, we believe that when our customers are successful in their missions, healthcare improves. Therefore, we focus on empowering them with data-driven solutions. And the momentum is building. Together, as ONE Inovalon, we are a united force delivering solutions that address healthcare's greatest needs. Through our mission-based culture of inclusion and innovation, our organization brings value not just to our customers, but to the millions of patients and members they serve.Overview: Acquire, analyze and report on client data and information. Will collaborate with other team members, such as Business Analysts, Subject Matter Experts, etc. to aid in gathering, interpreting and reporting pertinent information to the client. Duties and Responsibilities: Work with stakeholders and clients to identify Business Intelligence needs and work towards actionable data and insights; Dive deep into data to uncover trends, data quality, and data completeness; Support writing complex SQL queries and SQL performance tuning; Support the development and implementation of data marts, data structures, functions, data warehouse fact &amp; dimension tables, views, and indexes; Provide guidance and counsel to project/program leadership based on analysis of operational data with regards to business improvement; In collaboration with project/program leadership, define key insights and metrics which the business needs to address, and develop appropriate datasets, analytics, dashboards, or methods; Create and maintain views into data sets to provide visualization of data analysis; Take data analysis and insights capability to the next level; work with data infrastructure to ensure that data is accessible, audit existing visualization dashboards, and work with stakeholders to recommend and create new reporting/insights; Provide clear, timely, and accurate communication to business unit leadership/appropriate audiences on analysis, findings, and key insights; Deliver training as required to teams on newly developed or improved processes, systems, and tools; Identify data trends and make recommendations for quality improvement; Support initiatives for data integrity and normalization; Maintain compliance with Inovalon's policies, procedures and mission statement; Adhere to all confidentiality and HIPAA requirements as outlined within Inovalon's Operating Policies and Procedures in all ways and at all times with respect to any aspect of the data handled or services rendered in the undertaking of the position; and Fulfill those responsibilities and/or duties that may be reasonably provided by Inovalon for the purpose of achieving operational and financial success of the Employer. Job Requirements: Minimum of 3 years related experience; Possess advanced SQL skills; Possess healthcare experience including industry trends, terminology, and typical processes; Understand how business decisions are evaluated across operations, finance, risk, and people practices. Applies this understanding to identify opportunities for improved decision making; Possess advanced business acumen and working knowledge of typical company operations; Through analysis, is skilled at providing the relevant information people need in order to succeed in their roles, formulate accurate decisions and take appropriate action; Proven track record of solving complex problems; Experience in data visualizations/BI tools - Looker / Tableau is preferred; Strong knowledge of statistics and ability to translate this into non-technical terms; Demonstrated success in building trusted relationships with internal/external clients and customers; Passion for the use of data and business intelligence principles and their ability to optimize business outcomes; Demonstrated ability to handle large data sets and relational databases; Excellent organizational, leadership, interpersonal, communication (written, verbal, and visual), and analytical skills. Education: Associate's degree in technology or statistics required; and Bachelor's Degree in a technology or statistical related field preferred. Physical Demands and Work Environment: Sedentary work (i.e. sitting for long periods of time); Exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force; Frequently or constantly to lift, carry push, pull or otherwise move objects and repetitive motions; Subject to inside environmental conditions; and Travel for this position will include less than 5% locally usually for training purposes. Studies have shown that women and people of color are less likely to apply for jobs unless they believe they meet every one of the qualifications listed in a job description. If you don't meet every qualification listed but are excited about our mission and the work described, we encourage you to apply regardless. Inovalon is most interested in finding the best candidate for the job and you may be just the right person for this or other roles. By embracing diversity, equity and inclusion we enhance our work environment and drive business success. Inovalon strives to reflect the diversity of the communities where we operate and of our clients and everyone whom we serve. We endeavor to create a culture of inclusion in which our associates feel empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work and pursue their professional goals in an equitable setting. We understand that by fostering this type of culture, and welcoming different perspectives, we generate innovation and growth. Inovalon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirement. The Company maintains a drug free work environment for all of its associates, which includes employees, contractors and vendors. It is unlawful for associates to manufacture, sell, distribute, dispense, possess or use any controlled substance or marijuana in the workplace and doing so will result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment or the contracted relationship.PDN-993b765e-9b63-4820-9e72-a676865a017c

title: Data Engineer
description: <strong>About Us</strong><p><br></p>Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people. Dyson launched in the US in 2002, and since then operations have grown exponentially. Our US headquarters is based in Chicago's Fulton Market neighborhood. We also have employees working in field sales, our service centers, and in our growing number of Dyson Demo Store’s across the country.<p><br></p>Data and analytics excellence at Dyson is delivered by a diverse and collaborative global community, at the heart of that community is a hub team that enables all others: In Dyson’s Data Analytics team, there has been significant investment into cloud technologies and tools; combined with an expansive scope and no shortage of ambition and momentum, Dyson Data Analytics team is recognized throughout the organization to the highest level as critical to all of Dyson's strategic objectives. With a ‘one-team’ approach, the global community is on a mission to: Evolve existing solutions to stay ahead; Embed emerging solutions to capitalize on potential benefits; Deliver conceptualized and future solutions to introduce net-new capability.<p><br></p><strong>About The Role</strong><p><br></p>At Dyson, Data Engineers are Software Engineers specializing in building data intensive applications. In this role, you will be responsible for:<p><br></p><ul><li>Delivering Data Engineering excellence in the end-to-end delivery of complex data engineering projects and programs for Dyson </li><li>Reviewing technical designs and providing feedback </li><li>Designing and building end-to-end data solutions for analytics </li><li>Migrating existing pipelines onto the platform </li><li>Deployment, testing activities with hands on engineering and automation experience including CI/CD/CD and DataOps mindset </li><li>Adapting quickly to change in requirements and be willing to work with different technologies if required </li><li>Developing and maintaining data pipelines in a Backend/Distributed Data Systems team while remaining hands-on is very important </li><li>Strengthening data quality and reliability </li><li>Improving data lineage and governance </li><li>Progressing standards and best practices for the platform and operational excellence </li><li>Maintaining our documentation culture </li></ul> <strong> <br><br><strong>About You<br></strong><ul><li>Adept at writing clean code that can be easily understood by others </li><li>Able to understand and improve legacy code </li><li>Identify and build abstractions and tools to solve recurring challenges</li><li>Apply best practices and ways of working among our global data engineering team </li><li>Provide constructive feedback through PRs and pairing </li><li>Seek to close gaps in documentation </li><li>You feel strongly about data and want to empower the organization with it  </li><li>You seek technical excellence and is self-driven and motivated </li><li>You want to build robust, scalable and reliable software and solutions </li><li>You have experience with SQL and strong programming skills in a modern language (Python/Kotlin/Java/Scala) </li><li>You are comfortable writing production grade software that solves problems often presented with ambiguity </li><li>You proactively identify challenges and opportunities; seeking improvement as a team. </li></ul> <strong>Benefits:<br><br></strong>At Dyson, how we reward you is linked to our high-performance culture. But it’s about more than salary and bonus. Through a package of financial, lifestyle and health benefits, we support whatever stage of life you’re in and the moments that matter.<br><br><strong>Financial Benefits<br></strong><ul><li>401K with up to a 4% match</li><li>Company paid Life Insurance and AD&amp;D</li><li>Flexible Savings Account (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Lifestyle Benefits<br></strong><ul><li>Competitive Paid Time Off Benefits including Separate Holiday, Sick, and Vacation Time</li><li>Pre-tax Commuter Benefits (applicable areas only)</li><li>Generous Child Care Leave Program</li><li>Wellness Program</li><li>Employee Assistance Program</li><li>Generous Dyson Product Discounts<br><br></li></ul><strong>Health Benefits<br></strong><ul><li>Multi-Level Healthcare Coverage Options</li><li>Vision &amp; Dental Coverage</li><li>Company paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability <br><br></li></ul>Dyson is an equal opportunity employer. We know that great minds don’t think alike, and it takes all kinds of minds to make our technology so unique. We welcome applications from all backgrounds and employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other any other dimension of diversity.</strong>

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description: Our Client, is seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst<p><br></p><strong> Location: </strong>Skokie, IL/ Hybrid<p><br></p><strong> Position Type:</strong> IT Full Time<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p>The Business Intelligence Expert is responsible for defining dashboards with segments and create front-end frames and working models. You will work with data from multiple sources to create front end dashboards and reporting visualizations.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Power BI Developer with experience in Data Visualization and Data analytics.</li><li> Strong DAX and Power Query skills are required.</li><li> Building Tabular a Data Model in SSAS, SQL, Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Managed Instance, or SQL Server on Azure VM's. </li><li> Developing visual reports, dashboards, and KPI scorecards using Power BI desktop</li><li> Experience developing Tabular reports in Power BI Desktop, SQL Server Reporting Services (SRRS), or equivalent.</li><li> Connecting to data sources, importing data, and transforming data for business purposes.</li><li> Analytical thinking to translate data into informative visuals and reports.</li><li> Develop advanced level calculations in data sets.</li><li> Responsible for documentation (where applicable) and training for end users.</li><li> Work with subject matter experts from sites to develop reports per business requirements.</li><li> Knowledge of databases and SQL hands-on experience in writing SQL Queries.</li><li> Willing to work on any Data Analytical tools like Excel, Power BI, Tableau, etc.</li><li> Working knowledge of Power BI Service, Gateway and Power Automate.</li><li> Implement row-level security on data and have an understanding of application security layer models in Power BI.</li><li> Development of visualizations and interactivity (Bar Chart, Line Chart, Scatter Plot, Heat maps, combined charts, bookmarks, report interfaces, slicers/filters, themes, animations, etc.)</li><li> Working knowledge of Office365 groups/ workspaces </li><li> Visual Studio experience a plus </li><li> Excellent problem-solving/troubleshooting skills required.</li><li> Developing Algorithms &amp; Programs</li></ul> <strong> Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> +3 years of Power BI development experience.</li><li> Finance experience is preferred but not required.</li><li> Retail experience is preferred but not required.</li><li> Experience and familiarity with Microsoft tools.</li><li> Excellent communication skills and willingness to grow on any Data tool.</li><li> Identify, analyze and interpret trends and patterns in complex data sets.</li><li> Strong analytical skills to organize and analyze significant data sets with attention to detail and accuracy.</li><li> Comfortable with queries, report writing and presenting findings.</li><li> Ability to work independently and within a team environment.</li></ul> <strong> Salary Range: </strong>$115,000

title: Data Analyst (19-22/hr)
description: <ul><li>Looking for:* *-Proficient in Excel (Highly proficient skills: create spreadsheets, formulas, Vlook ups and pivot tables is a plus)* *-2-4 years of data heavy position* *-HS Diploma or GED*</li><li>Hours:* Monday through Friday</li><li>8am to 5pm* 2 days in office, 3 days remote</li><li>Description:* The new business job family roles will be responsible for the retrieval, validation, and processing of all worksite and group benefit enrollment files and manual production submissions inclusive of file balancing and audits. The team will be responsible for accurate processing of new enrollments, routing of benefit changes, and handling of termination notifications. Job responsibilities:</li><li>Ability to work with large data sets and run simple formula (VLOOKUP and logic functions are a plus)</li><li>Perform quality assurance and testing to ensure accuracy of setup and ability to process new business</li><li>Retrieve data files from various enrollment platforms and secure server transmissions; validate format and completeness of information received based upon product requirements, and prepare to load into administrative system</li><li>Review state and product compliance requirements, ensure appropriate approvals have been received</li><li>Provide support to field sales, brokers, and employer groups to resolve issues, collect missing information, and ensure accuracy of information received</li><li>Investigate errors that occur on assigned employer groups, research issue and follow through to resolution partnering with internal stakeholders</li><li>Escalate errors and risks as appropriate to bring to resolution and management intervention</li><li>Meet or exceed department established production and quality goals, ensuring service levels are met</li><li>Provide superior customer support to internal and external customers<br><br></li></ul>About Aston Carter:<br><br>Please Note: Scammers are posing as Aston Carter. We'll never contact you via Gmail, Telegram, or WhatsApp and we'll never solicit money from you.<br><br>At Aston Carter, we’re dedicated to expanding career opportunities for the skilled professionals who power our business. Our success is driven by the talented, motivated people who join our team across a range of positions – from recruiting, sales and delivery to corporate roles. As part of our team, employees have the opportunity for long-term career success, where hard work is rewarded and the potential for growth is limitless. Established in 1997, Aston Carter is a leading staffing and consulting firm, providing high-caliber talent and premium services to more than 7,000 companies across North America. Spanning four continents and more than 200 offices, we extend our clients’ capabilities by seeking solvers and delivering solutions to address today’s workforce challenges. For organizations looking for innovative solutions shaped by critical-thinking professionals, visit [AstonCarter.com.](AstonCarter.com) Aston Carter is a company within Allegis Group, a global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. If you would like to request a reasonable accommodation, such as the modification or adjustment of the job application process or interviewing process due to a disability, please call 888-237-6835 or email [astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com](mailto:%20astoncarteraccommodation@astoncarter.com) for other accommodation options. However, if you have questions about this position, please contact the Recruiter located at the bottom of the job posting. The Recruiter is the sole point of contact for questions about this position.

title: Data Engineer
description: Brand/Omnichannel Analytics Data Engineering<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>" Guide and execute the build-out and improvement of the brand analytics and marketing analytics and enablement data ecosystem, including the marketing/customer data, promotional data and analytics data layer. Work in close collaboration with all marketing and sales support teams, including Commercial Insights, Data Strategy, Information Systems (IS), Omnichannel Strategy and Operations (OSO), and Field Analytics.<p><br></p>" Provide ongoing operational support for current/active data mart functionality and drive greater efficiencies through continued analysis and improvement of analytics-ready data sets, process refinement, documentation and education. Serve as primary point of contact for all data-related support. Manage business requirements and data solution designs responsible for implementing omni-channel programs and day-to-day operations of the omnichannel and brand analytics teams.<p><br></p>" Evolve data capabilities roadmap and drive adoption of future capabilities, environment enhancements and necessary process improvements. Partner with AWS infrastructure team and Information Systems (IS) to maintain and expand database capabilities by ensuring the analytics vision is supported while defining business and user requirements, release roadmaps, and stakeholder coordination.<p><br></p>" Manage and maintain customer and customer engagement data sources, derived analytics-ready data, including those required to build customer 360 database. Establish and maintain standards, business rules, and processes for data sourcing, on-boarding, and ingestion. Partner with IS on data utilization for and integration with analytics and marketing automation capability. Define and document business rules that translate campaign requirements into technical specifications. Support implementation, execution and ongoing assessment of analytics-derived recommendations, including target lists, next best action suggestions, and alerts, by applying appropriate business/ compliance rules, developing tools to support effective communications/ reporting to key stakeholders, and partnering internal and external stakeholders to manage data loading to/from Astellas production systems.<p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Masters degree or the foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field, and 24-36 months of experience in the same or closely similar role.<p><br></p>Alternate Requirements: Bachelors degree or the foreign equivalent in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or related field, and 48-60 months of experience in the same or closely similar role.<p><br></p>Three (3) or more years of experience operating in a matrix environment, and involving all of the following:<p><br></p><ul><li> Handling commercial data management, including data modeling, data extraction, data transformation, data load, data validation &amp; reconciliation, and data centralization from multiple relational databases.</li><li> Managing the design, implementation, and execution of robust data integration processes and data flows between the data warehouse and source/target systems.</li><li> Handling project management including planning, task prioritization, objective setting, meeting management, and documentation.</li><li> Data management across the following systems and tools: java, Talend ETL, AWS, Redshift</li><li> Proficiency in SQL and working knowledge of R and/or Python</li></ul>

title: Associate Business Systems Analyst - PeopleSoft
description: LivCor , a Blackstone portfolio company, is a real estate asset management business specializing in multi-family housing. Formed in 2013 and headquartered in Chicago, LivCor is currently responsible for a portfolio of over 400 Class A and B properties comprising more than 150,000 units in markets across the United States.<p><br></p>Our business is focused on making real estate more valuable. But for us, it’s more than that. It’s people first, community always. It’s a life-filled career, not just a career-filled life. It’s doing good work, with good humans, and making a difference. It’s excellence in all its forms. Ultimately, we create great places to work, live, and grow. We do that by focusing on leaving people – and places – better than we found them.<p><br></p>Whew! Still with us? Cool. Let’s talk about where you’d fit in:<p><br></p>Data is at the core of everything we do, it powers business, empowers our people, and allows us to leave things better than we found them. Does it bug you when the corners of a stack of paper don’t align? Are you one of those people who fill in all the columns of a spreadsheet, even when it's fine being blank? Do you ensure that all your equations are balanced, a ledger needs to add up to zero sum, nothing is lost in translation, and you are able to explain discrepancies? If these apply to you, then we would love you to apply with us. LivCor is looking for a Data Integrity Engineer who is just shy of obsessive when it comes to data quality and process. The Data Integrity Engineer will ensure that the quality and security of data stored in our company systems is accurate, while also helping us to determine and support the future vision data strategy at LivCor.<p><br></p>LivCor is looking for a Data Integrity Engineer who is just shy of obsessive when it comes to data quality and process. This role is critical to help us deliver our data strategy and help us drive adoption of our modern BI platform by ensuring high degree of data accuracy. It's almost like being a version of Sherlock Holmes and Iron Man combined, as we crush through tons of data movements from various external and internal systems into our data warehouse helping solve the puzzles when data isn't adding up.<p><br></p>If this is you and you love working with amazing people, then LivCor is looking for you. The Data Integrity Engineer will be responsible for the quality of Data, starting from ingestion to any transformation by validating with source data. The Data Integrity Engineer will contribute to the design of information infrastructure and data management process to move the organization to a more sophisticated, agile, and robust target state data architecture.<p><br></p><strong><u>Only Read Further If You Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Kind </li><li> Humble </li><li> Honest </li><li> Relentless </li><li> Smart with Heart </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>You Should Be</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Authentic. You do you. Together, we’ll do something amazing. </li><li> A passionate person with a love for real estate and investing; and believes that helping others win is a noble cause, essential to our success. </li><li> An excellent team player who enjoys working with others and has strong interpersonal skills. </li><li> Highly motivated, energetic, and organized </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Do cool data stuff…LOTS of cool stuff…oh and with amazing humans. </li><li> Develop data validation test plans and test cases to ensure that business requirements are met. </li><li> Conduct test plans for validation of data mapping. Automate test if and when required to improve data testing process. </li><li> Write test cases in Zaphyr Scale to document test plans and coverage. </li><li> Investigate data errors or anomalies, and assisting with the implementation of solutions to rectify such as determining root causes. </li><li> Management of presentation for data quality outputs scoring and data profiling results (i.e., building Power BI dashboards for data quality checks internally). </li><li> Collaborate with rest of data integrity engineers to architect and build solutions to improve data quality. </li><li> Develop and maintain tools, templates, and methodologies to support the execution and implementation of LivCor data securities, policies and standards (e.g., work with LivCor data teams to ensure personally identifying information isn’t included in data sets, etc.). </li><li> Assist in identifying, automating, and maintaining data quality processes and standards. </li><li> Map new data elements in various applications to ensure data interpretations are maintained as data moves from system(s) to system(s). </li><li> Perform audits on key data elements and deliver data quality metrics to prove data integrity. </li><li> Assist with maintenance of data mapping documentation to maintain and improve data definitions. </li><li> Help us to make better decisions, empower our people, and solve problems. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Should Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 5+ years of combined relevant experience Data Engineering, Data Warehousing, data modeling, ETL/ELT process or Data Quality discipline </li><li> 2+ years experience in Test Automation or script development to automate test execution </li><li> Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology or relevant work experience </li><li> Hands on experience in writing and optimizing efficient code in SQL, Python </li><li> Experience in Software Development Lifecycle best practices including source code management (Git) or similar system; continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD), and test-driven development. </li><li> Strong analytical skills and attention to detail </li><li> Experience in testing data visualization tools like Power BI, Looker and Tableau </li><li> Good to have experience with Databricks, ADO, JIRA and DBT </li><li> Demonstrated ability to handle multiple priorities, successfully resolve ambiguities, identify risks, and effectively tailor communication to technical and non-technical audiences </li><li> Knowledge of basic Data Governance processes </li><li> Knowledge of implementation and effectiveness of the Quality System including monitoring and Alerts </li><li> An overwhelming desire to see others succeed </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p>We know that if we take care of our team everything else will fall into place. We aren’t perfect, but we will try to set very clear expectations, always let you know where you stand, and do everything in our power to help you get where you want to go.<p><br></p>Our culture and values matter to us. A lot. We’re definitely not serious but we take this stuff seriously, if you get what we mean. We want a place that is an ego-free zone. A place where good people do good things together. It shouldn’t be rocket science in workplaces, but for some reason it still is? We’re absolutely determined to be different, and we think we’re doing a pretty good job at it. We have a CEO who makes fun of himself, and who will encourage you to tell him when he is wrong. In fact, he needs people to – we all do. Supportive challenge is good, it’s how we get better. We like getting better. We also love diversity, of all kinds. We need people who look, sound, speak, love, and exist differently from one another. This isn’t at the end of this paragraph because it’s an afterthought. It’s SO important to us we want it to stand out.<p><br></p>Right. On to the technical stuff that we know matters to you. We offer competitive pay that is commensurate with the market and relevant experience, and a full slate of benefits that even includes things like paid parental leave.<p><br></p>If any of this sounds interesting, then maybe we are a fit. Life is too short to work with people you don’t like. So whatever you do, don’t make that mistake.<p><br></p><strong> The LivCorian Values </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Be you. Be Real. Be Open . You do you. Together, we will do something amazing. </li><li> Care, Always. We don’t want to let anyone down. </li><li> Courageously Curious. We love to learn, even when it hurts. </li><li> Help Others Win, Be A Good Neighbor. This is about ‘We, not Me.’ </li><li> Relentless Hustle, Heart &amp; Humility . Work hard. Be Kind. Make Better. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>A Few Of The People You Will Work With</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Deepa Rao </li><li> Shilpa Madini </li><li> Michael Fernandez </li><li> Matt Lomas </li><li> Alicia Barco </li></ul><p><br></p><u>Base Salary Range</u> : $130,400 - $153,000. This represents the presently-anticipated low and high end of the Company’s base salary range for this position. Actual base salary range may vary based on various factors, including but not limited to location and experience.<p><br></p><u>Total Direct Compensation</u> : This job is also eligible for discretionary bonus and incentive compensation on an annual basis.<p><br></p><u>Benefits</u> : The Company provides a variety of benefits to employees, including health insurance coverage, retirement savings plan, paid holidays, and paid time off (PTO).<p><br></p><strong> LivCor is proud to be a US EPA ENERGY STAR® Partner </strong><p><br></p><strong> EEO Statement </strong><p><br></p>The Company is an equal opportunity employer. In accordance with applicable law, we prohibit discrimination against any applicant, employee, or other covered person based on any legally recognized basis, including, but not limited to: veteran status, uniformed servicemember status, race, color, caste, immigration status, religion, religious creed (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex, gender, gender expression, gender identity, marital status, sexual orientation, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation or related medical conditions), age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), protected leave status, domestic violence victim status, or any other consideration protected by federal, state or local law. We are committed to providing reasonable accommodations, if you need an accommodation to complete the application process, please email talent@revantage.com.<p><br></p>

title: Data Integrity Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>Robert Half is hiring an experienced Database Developer, so if you have a strong relational database background and want to work with a company in the Non-Profit field, you may be interested. In this role, you will be responsible for designing, building, and developing database architecture. If you consider yourself an authority on query writing and love developing systems, this may be the Database Developer position for you. This Database Developer position will be a permanent opportunity based in the Chicago, Illinois area.<br><br>What you get to do every day<br><ul><li> Provide documentation and training to the Database Administrator. Also supply training to other users when necessary</li><li> Produce a database schema based on the type of data and application-related function</li><li> Construct an efficient method for storing future database data</li><li> Develop, code, and implement relational databases<br></li></ul><strong><u>Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li> Expertise in SSIS</li><li> Microsoft Power BI experience preferred</li><li> Solid understanding of Microsoft SQL Server</li><li> Proficiency in SSRS</li><li> Knowledge and know-how to fix potential issues, and experience with industry standards for database operations</li><li> Solid grasp of query coding and relational databases</li><li> 5+ years working as a Database Developer or a related role<br></li></ul>Technology Doesn't Change the World, People Do.®<br><br>Robert Half is the world’s first and largest specialized talent solutions firm that connects highly qualified job seekers to opportunities at great companies. We offer contract, temporary and permanent placement solutions for finance and accounting, technology, marketing and creative, legal, and administrative and customer support roles.<br><br>Robert Half puts you in the best position to succeed by advocating on your behalf and promoting you to employers. We provide access to top jobs, competitive compensation and benefits, and free online training. Stay on top of every opportunity – even on the go.<br><br>All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Benefits are available to contract/temporary professionals, including medical, vision, dental, and life and disability insurance. Hired contract/temporary professionals are also eligible to enroll in our company 401(k) plan. Visit<br><br>© 2023 Robert Half. An Equal Opportunity Employer. M/F/Disability/Veterans. title: Database Developer
description: Argonne National Laboratory is seeking a technically strong energy systems analyst in the area of life cycle assessment and technology assessment to quantify energy, environmental, and cost effects of energy systems and/or materials. This is a full-time staff position with the Systems Assessment Center’s Materials Life Cycle Group in the Energy Systems and Infrastructure Analysis Division. We are seeking applicants with strong technical background and expertise of alternative fuel and/or low-carbon material technologies that are promising for decarbonization of the transportation, manufacturing industry, and/or agriculture sectors. The Energy Systems Analyst will have an opportunity to work on research areas including renewable natural gas production and supply chain, waste-to-energy/product, CO2 capture and utilization, sustainable aviation fuels, sustainable and carbon-smart agricultural farming practices, waste utilization technologies for energy and material production, critical material production and supply chain, and/or industry materials and decarbonization technologies.<p><br></p>The Energy Systems Analyst will collect, synthesize, and process information to develop high-quality databases and derive data-driven results; work with other team members to develop and apply LCA methodologies to address critical analytical issues; provide rigorous and objective results; publish journal articles and reports; and present results to sponsors and at conferences, workshops, and project meetings.<p><br></p>The Energy Systems Analyst will analyze energy systems and/or material technologies, collect and synthesize datasets, provide rigorous and objective results, and contribute to Argonne’s GREET LCA model development and expansion. The Analyst will collect and synthesize data and information for specific energy system and/or material technology to conduct LCA studies in the GREET modeling platform and other analyses, process large datasets to derive results, communicate results through presentations, journal articles, and reports, and present results to sponsors and stakeholders at conferences, workshops, and project meetings. The Energy Systems Analyst will further develop the GREET model to provide quantitative results for the life-cycle energy consumption, greenhouse gas emissions, criteria air pollutant emissions, and water consumption across the life cycles of energy systems and/or materials. The candidate will work closely with collaborators from other national labs and academia to understand complex systems and to incorporate new data in analyses. The Energy Systems Analyst will also contribute to annual updates of the GREET model through working with other researchers in the group to incorporate new and updated energy system and/or material pathways into the GREET model.<p><br></p>The Materials Life Cycle Group supports DOE and other sponsors to assess the energy and environmental impacts associated with energy systems, materials, and integrated systems to help DOE and other stakeholders guide R&amp;D efforts, identify improvement opportunities, and to create new methodologies to address emerging issues in LCA/sustainability analysis.<p><br></p>The Systems Assessment Center continues a 30-year history of leadership in the field of life cycle analysis. The Energy Systems Analyst will join project teams including experts in a variety of topics and will regularly collaborate with experts in other Argonne groups as well as in industry and at other national laboratories. The Systems Assessment Center develops and maintains the <u>G</u>reenhouse Gases, <u>R</u>egulated <u>E</u>missions, and <u>E</u>nergy Use in <u>T</u>echnologies (GREET) model which is widely used by government, industry, and academic stakeholders to provide objective and rigorous results (see greet.es.anl.gov).<p><br></p><strong>Position Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ph.D. degree in civil, chemical, mechanical engineering, environmental science/engineering, or related fields.</li><li>2-3 years of work experience in LCA or closely related area.</li><li>Expertise in topics related to process modeling and sustainability analysis of energy systems and/or materials.</li><li>Published peer-reviewed journal papers addressing environmental and sustainability performance and cost impacts of emerging energy systems and/or material technologies via LCA modeling and analysis.</li><li>Extensive experience in data-driven sustainability analysis.</li><li>Desire and passion to work as a part of a team in a highly collaborative environment.</li><li>Familiarity with a wide range of data sources relevant for environmental and sustainability analysis, and the ability to identify topics and data sources and engage experts to conduct research. Capable of identifying key features of complex systems/processes.</li><li>Well-developed problem-solving, systems thinking, quantitative, and critical thinking skills; intellectual curiosity. Able to structure and formulate solutions to complex problems.</li><li>Highly motivated attitude and detail-oriented approach with the ability to work independently to deliver. Energized by working as part of a highly collaborative and productive team.</li><li>Skilled written and verbal communicator, including the ability to present complex information so that it is understandable to a broad audience.</li><li>Breadth of knowledge in energy systems and/or critical materials and relevant issues.</li><li>A successful candidate must have the ability to model Argonne’s Core Values: Impact, Safety, Respect, Integrity, and Teamwork. </li></ul><p><br></p><u>Preferred Qualifications:</u><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with GREET and/or other LCA software such as openLCA preferred.</li><li>Computer programing skills relevant for data manipulation and analysis. Experience with creating and using complex data-driven analytical models in Excel with VBA scripting, and/or in open-source platforms using Python is preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p><u>Uploads</u><p><br></p><ul><li>Curriculum Vitae</li><li>Writing Sample, e.g., journal articles or project reports</li><li>Undergraduate and Graduate School Transcripts, unofficial is acceptable for initial application</li><li>Names and contact information for four references</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Family</strong><p><br></p>Research Development (RD)<p><br></p><strong>Job Profile</strong><p><br></p>Eng Systems Modeling-Simulation-Analysis 2<p><br></p><strong>Worker Type</strong><p><br></p>Regular<p><br></p><strong>Time Type</strong><p><br></p>Full time<p><br></p><em>As an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer, and in accordance with our core values of impact, safety, respect, integrity and teamwork, Argonne National Laboratory is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace that fosters collaborative scientific discovery and innovation. In support of this commitment, Argonne encourages minorities, women, veterans and individuals with disabilities to apply for employment. Argonne considers all qualified applicants for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship status, color, disability, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, marital status, national origin, pregnancy, race, religion, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em><p><br></p><em>Argonne employees, and certain guest researchers and contractors, are subject to particular restrictions related to participation in Foreign Government Sponsored or Affiliated Activities, as defined and detailed in United States Department of Energy Order 486.1A. You will be asked to disclose any such participation in the application phase for review by Argonne's Legal Department. </em><p><br></p><em>All Argonne offers of employment are contingent upon a background check that includes an assessment of criminal conviction history conducted on an individualized and case-by-case basis. Please be advised that Argonne positions require upon hire (or may require in the future) for the individual be to obtain a government access authorization that involves additional background check requirements. Failure to obtain or maintain such government access authorization could result in the withdrawal of a job offer or future termination of employment.</em><p><br></p><em>Please note that all Argonne employees are required to be vaccinated against COVID-19. All successful applicants will be required to provide their COVID-19 vaccination verification as a condition of employment, subject to limited legally recognized exemptions to COVID-19 vaccination.</em>

title: Energy Systems Analyst
description: Same as Business/System Analyst 1 plus participates in project work, including analysis and requirements definition and testing. Identifies system enhancements, document business needs and determines development impacts to current system processing and works with programmers and users to ensure accuracy or enhancements. Consults on development and updating of training materials and user manuals and prepares documentation for assigned products. Provides daily production support to assigned system(s) to identify production problems and resolves systems problems. Participates in conversions, mergers, maintenance and development projects, including analysis and testing. Completes special projects, and performs systems testing and other assigned duties. Bachelor's degree OR equivalent experience. Minimum 3 6 years of experience.<p><br></p><strong><u>Support For Multiple Data Strategy Projects, Including</u></strong><p><br></p>Project Tracking &amp; Leadership Status Reporting<p><br></p>Technology Support, Testing &amp; Training Development<p><br></p>Operational Support Management &amp; User Provisioning<p><br></p>Supports Leadership/Mgmt with Plan Request Intake &amp; Fulfillment<p><br></p>Analytics / Data Refresh<p><br></p>Support Leadership/Mgmt with Plan Support &amp; Training/Demos<p><br></p>Resource will support multiple Data Strategy projects at varying degrees, including but not limited to, CHM Hub(R), HE Data Store, Network Optimization, Data Strategy, and other General Operations work.<p><br></p>Project Tracking &amp; Leadership Status Reporting Resource to provide support on project/request tracking, weekly working team calls, and leadership status calls/reports. Resource to lead scrum calls and follow-ups.<p><br></p>Technology Support &amp; Training Development Resource participates in daily scrums, and once up to speed, supports Sowmya with smoke testing and releases. Resource may be responsible for developing training materials / decks and setting up training calls; all steps and templates will be detailed in operations manual.<p><br></p>Solution Operations Support Management (with oversight from Manager) &amp; User Provisioning manages CHM Hub inbox for new Plan requests, user provisioning, and issues reported by end users. Reviews each request and proposed response with Manager 2-3x per week to close out inbox items.<p><br></p>Supports Leadership/Mgmt with Plan Request Intake &amp; Fulfillment Fulfills administrative aspects of Plan requests (call scheduling, agenda setting, note/action item taking, follow-ups as directed).<p><br></p>Analytics / Data Refresh provide support, QA, and analysis for repeatable data refresh efforts<p><br></p>Support Leadership/Mgmt with Plan Support Provides administrative support to Sowmya on Plan requests. Resource leads project tracking and deliverable status.<p><br></p>Support Leadership/Mgmt with Training/Demos Supports Manager with training prep, ROS, and talking points.<p><br></p><ul><li>Talteam Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.**</li></ul>

title: Python Developer (W2)
description: <strong>Organization- Hyatt Corporate Office, Chicago</strong><p><br></p><strong>Summary</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Opportunity </strong><p><br></p>Hyatt Hotels Corporation seeks an enthusiastic Development professional to join our North America Select Service Development team. In this role, you will be collaborating closely with the broader Development team, where you’ll be instrumental in continuing to make Hyatt a leading hospitality company. This position will be responsible for driving the growth of Hyatt’s new upper-midscale extended-stay brand, Hyatt Studios, in a particular territory. You will be part of a team that is passionate about diversity, equity, and inclusion, committed to nurturing curiosity and new skills and building connections across the organization with stakeholders, colleagues, and guests.<p><br></p><strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>At Hyatt, we believe in the power of belonging and creating a culture of care, where our colleagues become family. Since 1957, our colleagues and guests have been at the heart of our business and helped Hyatt become one of the world's best and fastest-growing hospitality brands. Our transformative growth and the addition of new hotels, brands, and business lines can open the door for exciting career and growth opportunities for our colleagues.<p><br></p>As we continue to grow, we never lose sight of what’s most important: People. We turn trips into journeys, encounters into experiences, and jobs into careers.<p><br></p><strong>Why Now?</strong><p><br></p>This is an exciting time to be at Hyatt. We are growing rapidly and are looking for passionate changemakers to be a part of our journey. The hospitality industry is resilient and continues to offer dynamic opportunities for upward mobility, and Hyatt is no exception.<p><br></p><strong>How We Care For Our People</strong><p><br></p>Our purpose sets us apart—to care for people so they can be their best. Every business decision is made through the lens of our purpose, and it informs how we have and will continue to support each other as members of the Hyatt family. Our care for our colleagues is the key to our success. We’re proud to have earned a place on Fortune’s prestigious 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the last ten years. This recognition is a testament to the tremendous way our Hyatt family continues to come together to care for one another, our commitment to a culture of inclusivity, empathy, and respect, and making sure everyone feels like they belong.<p><br></p><strong>We’re proud to offer exceptional corporate benefits which include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Annual allotment of free hotel stays at Hyatt hotels globally</li><li>Flexible work schedule and location</li><li>Work-life benefits including well-being initiatives such as a complimentary Headspace subscription, and a discount at the on-site fitness center</li><li>A global family assistance policy with paid time off following the birth or adoption of a child as well as financial assistance for adoption</li><li>Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>Our success is underpinned by our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and we are committed to diversity across the board—from whom we hire and develop, the organizations we support, and whom we buy from and work with.<p><br></p>Being part of Hyatt means always having space to be you. Our global teams are a mosaic of cultures, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, and identities. We constantly strive to reflect the world we care for with teams that achieve and grow together. To learn more about our commitments to DE&amp;I, please visit the Why Hyatt section of the Hyatt career page.<p><br></p><strong>Who You Are</strong><p><br></p>As our ideal candidate, you understand the power and purpose of our Culture of Care and embody our core values of Empathy, Inclusion, Integrity, Experimentation, Respect, and Well-being. You enjoy working with others, are results-driven, and are looking for a variety of opportunities to develop personally and professionally.<p><br></p><strong>The Role </strong><p><br></p>The Developer role requires a wide and varied skill base, an understanding of local hotel markets, ability to develop relationships and convince developers that Hyatt products are well-suited for the location and market.<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop relationships with possible franchises &amp; other partners to grow the Hyatt system with a focus on Hyatt Studios</li><li>Identify locations and markets in which to focus time and effort</li><li>Prepare and analyze market and performance data to demonstrate why the Hyatt Studios brand is the right fit for a market</li><li>Bring new Hyatt projects forward for approval through Hyatt’s internal Select Development Committee</li><li>Negotiate terms and conditions of each franchise agreement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Experience Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 + years of hotel franchise sales and development, hotel feasibility, hotel financial analysis or other sales-related experience.</li></ul><p><br></p>Established relationships with owners, operators, consultants, management companies, lenders, builders, etc.<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong negotiation and influencing skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor.</li><li>Ability to multi-task and handle multiple relationships and deals</li><li>Ability to travel approximately 75% of the time</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience Preferred:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Hotel Management, Real Estate, or Finance</li></ul><p><br></p>The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.<p><br></p><strong>We welcome you:</strong><p><br></p>Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. Unsure if you check every box, but feeling inspired to enhance your career? Apply. We’d love to consider your unique experiences and how you could make Hyatt even better.

The hospitality industry is resilient and continues to offer dynamic opportunities for upward mobility, and Hyatt is no exception.<p><br></p><strong>How We Care For Our People</strong><p><br></p>Our purpose sets us apart—to care for people so they can be their best. Our care for our colleagues is the key to our success. We’re proud to have earned a place on Fortune’s prestigious 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the last ten years. This recognition is a testament to the tremendous way our Hyatt family continues to come together to care for one another, our commitment to a culture of inclusivity, empathy, and respect, and making sure everyone feels like they belong.<p><br></p><strong>We’re proud to offer exceptional corporate benefits which include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Annual allotment of free hotel stays at Hyatt hotels globally</li><li>Flexible work schedule and location</li><li>Work-life benefits including well-being initiatives such as a complimentary Headspace subscription, and a discount at the on-site fitness center</li><li>A global family assistance policy with paid time off following the birth or adoption of a child as well as financial assistance for adoption</li><li>Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>Our success is underpinned by our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and we are committed to diversity across the board—from whom we hire and develop, the organizations we support, and whom we buy from and work with.<p><br></p>Being part of Hyatt means always having space to be you. You enjoy working with others, are results-driven, and are looking for a variety of opportunities to develop personally and professionally.<p><br></p><strong>The Role </strong><p><br></p>The Developer role requires a wide and varied skill base, an understanding of local hotel markets, ability to develop relationships and convince developers that Hyatt products are well-suited for the location and market.<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop relationships with possible franchises &amp; other partners to grow the Hyatt system with a focus on Hyatt Studios</li><li>Identify locations and markets in which to focus time and effort</li><li>Prepare and analyze market and performance data to demonstrate why the Hyatt Studios brand is the right fit for a market</li><li>Bring new Hyatt projects forward for approval through Hyatt’s internal Select Development Committee</li><li>Negotiate terms and conditions of each franchise agreement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Experience Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 + years of hotel franchise sales and development, hotel feasibility, hotel financial analysis or other sales-related experience.</li></ul><p><br></p>Established relationships with owners, operators, consultants, management companies, lenders, builders, etc.<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong negotiation and influencing skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor.</li><li>Ability to multi-task and handle multiple relationships and deals</li><li>Ability to travel approximately 75% of the time</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience Preferred:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Hotel Management, Real Estate, or Finance</li></ul><p><br></p>The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. title: Developer, Midwest
description: <strong>Organization- Hyatt Corporate Office, Chicago</strong><p><br></p><strong>Summary</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Opportunity</strong><p><br></p>Hyatt seeks an enthusiastic Development professional to join our North America Select Service Development team. In this role, you will be collaborating closely with the broader Development team, where you’ll be instrumental in continuing to make Hyatt a leading hospitality company. This position will be responsible for driving the growth of Hyatt’s new upper-midscale extended-stay brand, Hyatt Studios, in a particular territory. You will be part of a team that is passionate about diversity, equity, and inclusion, committed to nurturing curiosity and new skills and building connections across the organization with stakeholders, colleagues, and guests.<p><br></p><strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>At Hyatt, we believe in the power of belonging and creating a culture of care, where our colleagues become family. Since 1957, our colleagues and guests have been at the heart of our business and helped Hyatt become one of the world's best and fastest-growing hospitality brands. Our transformative growth and the addition of new hotels, brands, and business lines can open the door for exciting career and growth opportunities for our colleagues.<p><br></p>As we continue to grow, we never lose sight of what’s most important: People. We turn trips into journeys, encounters into experiences, and jobs into careers.<p><br></p><strong>Why Now?</strong><p><br></p>This is an exciting time to be at Hyatt. We are growing rapidly and are looking for passionate changemakers to be a part of our journey. The hospitality industry is resilient and continues to offer dynamic opportunities for upward mobility, and Hyatt is no exception.<p><br></p><strong>How We Care For Our People</strong><p><br></p>Our purpose sets us apart—to care for people so they can be their best. Every business decision is made through the lens of our purpose, and it informs how we have and will continue to support each other as members of the Hyatt family. Our care for our colleagues is the key to our success. We’re proud to have earned a place on Fortune’s prestigious 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the last ten years. This recognition is a testament to the tremendous way our Hyatt family continues to come together to care for one another, our commitment to a culture of inclusivity, empathy, and respect, and making sure everyone feels like they belong.<p><br></p><strong>We’re proud to offer exceptional corporate benefits which include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Annual allotment of free hotel stays at Hyatt hotels globally</li><li>Flexible work schedule and location</li><li>Work-life benefits including well-being initiatives such as a complimentary Headspace subscription, and a discount at the on-site fitness center</li><li>A global family assistance policy with paid time off following the birth or adoption of a child as well as financial assistance for adoption</li><li>Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>Our success is underpinned by our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and we are committed to diversity across the board—from whom we hire and develop, the organizations we support, and whom we buy from and work with.<p><br></p>Being part of Hyatt means always having space to be you. Our global teams are a mosaic of cultures, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, and identities. We constantly strive to reflect the world we care for with teams that achieve and grow together. To learn more about our commitments to DE&amp;I, please visit the Why Hyatt section of the Hyatt career page.<p><br></p><strong>Who You Are</strong><p><br></p>As our ideal candidate, you understand the power and purpose of our Culture of Care and embody our core values of Empathy, Inclusion, Integrity, Experimentation, Respect, and Well-being. You enjoy working with others, are results-driven, and are looking for a variety of opportunities to develop personally and professionally.<p><br></p><strong>The Role</strong><p><br></p>The Developer role requires a wide and varied skill base, an understanding of local hotel markets, ability to develop relationships and convince developers that Hyatt products are well-suited for the location and market.<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop relationships with possible franchises &amp; other partners to grow the Hyatt system with a focus on Hyatt Studios</li><li>Identify locations and markets in which to focus time and effort</li><li>Prepare and analyze market and performance data to demonstrate why the Hyatt Studios brand is the right fit for a market</li><li>Bring new Hyatt projects forward for approval through Hyatt’s internal Select Development Committee</li><li>Negotiate terms and conditions of each franchise agreement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Experience Required: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 + years of hotel franchise sales and development, hotel feasibility, hotel financial analysis or other sales-related experience.</li></ul><p><br></p>Established relationships with owners, operators, consultants, management companies, lenders, builders, etc.<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong negotiation and influencing skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor.</li><li>Ability to multi-task and handle multiple relationships and deals</li><li>Ability to travel approximately 75% of the time</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience Preferred:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Hotel Management, Real Estate, or Finance</li></ul><p><br></p>The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.<p><br></p><strong>We welcome you:</strong><p><br></p>Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. Unsure if you check every box, but feeling inspired to enhance your career? Apply. We’d love to consider your unique experiences and how you could make Hyatt even better.

title: Data Delivery & Visualization Engineer
description: <strong>Position:</strong> Associate Business Systems Analyst<p><br></p><strong>Duration:</strong> 6-12+ months<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Chicago, IL 60606<p><br></p>I am looking for a Jr Business Systems Analyst with 2+ years of ERP support experience. In this role you will be joining the HR Technology department, to administer and support the PeopleSoft applications for HR, Talent management, Compensation, Performance Management and Succession Planning.<p><br></p><strong>In this role you will </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Perform basic fixes and data maintenance. </li><li>Help evaluate and test existing system configurations to provide recommendations to increase efficiency, streamline processes, and improve overall usability. </li><li>Provide production support, application maintenance and documentation for all PeopleSoft v9.2 modules including Core HR, Compensation, Performance &amp; Talent Management within scope of responsibility. </li><li>Assist with end user troubleshooting, including but not limited to researching and resolving system problems, system access issues, unexpected results, or process flaws. </li><li>Identify and track issues with assigned applications, working within a ticketing system from issue inception to resolution. </li><li>Partner with team members to troubleshoot and resolve complex problems. </li><li>Assist with project activities as needed including testing, training, and documentation.</li><li>Develop/deliver/maintain end user training and system documentation as needed. </li><li>Look for process improvement opportunities within team procedures and day to day responsibilities. </li><li>Complete required training and actively seek opportunities for professional growth and development. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong Customer Service skills and exceptional interpersonal skills</li><li>Best in class communicator - strong oral and written communication skills</li><li>Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience </li><li>Prior experience working in an office environment.</li><li>Microsoft Office proficiency required (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) </li><li>Intermediate to advanced Microsoft Excel skills (e.g., VLOOKUPs, Pivot Tables, etc.) </li><li>Experience with PeopleSoft or an HCM system a plus </li><li>Experience with a case tracking system such as ServiceNow a plus</li><li>Ability to work effectively both independently and as a member of a team. </li><li>Ability to multitask in a highly dynamic environment with a strong attention to detail and commitment to quality. </li><li>Strong learning agility; able to learn new skills, processes, and technologies quickly.</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Did you know about Sterling?</strong></em><em> As a Sterling W2 employee on contract, you are becoming an owner in Sterling. We are an Employee-Owned ESOP (Employee Stock Option Program) Company, that in itself is an additional retirement benefit on top of our other exceptional Sterling benefits, including paid holidays, PTO, the ability to join the 401K with a company match. Sterling Engineering / Staffing could be your future home.</em><p><br></p><strong>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</strong><p><br></p><strong>#SP</strong>

title: Developer, South Central
description: Sentinel is seeking Microsoft engineer proficient in Microsoft solutions including Azure, O365, Active Directory, Active Directory Domain Services and Exchange. In this role you will be working with various customers and their systems to ensure any migrations, support, and implementations are completed accurately and timely. If you are looking for a role that brings a lot of variety of work to your day with high scope of growth and advancement, this role is for you! This is a full-time position located in Downers Grove, IL.<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Microsoft Cloud Technologies such as Azure, O365, Active Directory, Exchange online</li><li>Experience with Active Directory Domain controllers in the development and production environment</li><li>Windows Server including the use of Hyper V or VMWare. </li><li>Basic support experience with Networking and Storage</li><li>Intermediate PowerShell experience</li><li>Excellent communication skills</li><li>The candidate must have a car, as this position requires travel between location and the transportation of equipment </li><li>A valid driver’s license and proof of vehicle insurance will be required</li><li>Legally authorized to work in the US without sponsorship</li><li>Must demonstrate a “can-do” attitude</li></ul><p><br></p>We focus on candidates that display our “ACE” factor – Attitude, Compassion, and Enthusiasm to deliver quality solutions with exceptional customer service.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Get</u></strong><p><br></p>We offer an energetic work environment with many corporate culture amenities, competitive salary, and rich benefit plan including: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K, 529, Life Insurance, Income Protection Short and Long-Term Disability, Medical and Child/Elder Care, Flexible Spending Account Plans, Employee Assistance Program, Two weeks vacation, additional paid time-off for Personal and Sick, certification and hands-on training, and discounts for local event entertainment and health clubs.<p><br></p>MOTIVATED…..make IT happen!<p><br></p>Sentinel Technologies, Inc. has been rated a top workplace every year since 2012!<p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Sentinel delivers solutions that can efficiently address a range of IT needs – from security, to communications, to systems &amp; networks, to software applications, to cloud and managed services; all of which include our staffing solutions for our clients. Since 1982, Sentinel has grown from providing technology maintenance services to our current standing as one of the leading IT services and solutions provider in the US. We have aligned with many of today’s global technology leaders including Cisco, Dell, VMware and Microsoft. Sentinel services customers both nationally and internationally with primary support operating centers in Downers Grove (HQ), Chicago, and Springfield, IL; Phoenix, AZ.; Detroit, Lansing, and Grand Rapids, MI; Milwaukee, WI; Denver, CO; and Fort Lauderdale, FL.<p><br></p>If you are MOTIVATED… you can make IT happen at Sentinel. Our commitment to our employees is to create a work environment that encourages creativity, an entrepreneurial spirit, fosters growth through certification and hands-on training, and values a team-oriented culture with rewards based on impact!<p><br></p>If you share our passion about what technology can do and want to be part of a top workplace environment – we’d like to have you join our team. Learn more at www.sentinel.com/careers.<p><br></p>As part of Sentinel's employment process, candidates will be required to complete a background check. Only those who meet the minimum requirements will be contacted. No phone calls please.<p><br></p>Sentinel is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, marital status, genetics, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other basis protected by law.<p><br></p>If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance in applying for a position, please contact SentinelHR1@sentinel.com.<p><br></p>Job ID: 2023-3862<p><br></p>Street: 2550 Warrenville Rd.
