description: <strong>Organization- Hyatt Corporate Office, Chicago</strong><p><br></p><strong>Summary</strong><p><br></p><strong>The Opportunity </strong><p><br></p>Hyatt Hotels Corporation seeks an enthusiastic Development professional to join our North America Select Service Development team. In this role, you will be collaborating closely with the broader Development team, where you’ll be instrumental in continuing to make Hyatt a leading hospitality company. This position will be responsible for driving the growth of Hyatt’s new upper-midscale extended-stay brand, Hyatt Studios, in a particular territory. You will be part of a team that is passionate about diversity, equity, and inclusion, committed to nurturing curiosity and new skills and building connections across the organization with stakeholders, colleagues, and guests.<p><br></p><strong>Who We Are</strong><p><br></p>At Hyatt, we believe in the power of belonging and creating a culture of care, where our colleagues become family. Since 1957, our colleagues and guests have been at the heart of our business and helped Hyatt become one of the world's best and fastest-growing hospitality brands. Our transformative growth and the addition of new hotels, brands, and business lines can open the door for exciting career and growth opportunities for our colleagues.<p><br></p>As we continue to grow, we never lose sight of what’s most important: People. We turn trips into journeys, encounters into experiences, and jobs into careers.<p><br></p><strong>Why Now?</strong><p><br></p>This is an exciting time to be at Hyatt. We are growing rapidly and are looking for passionate changemakers to be a part of our journey. The hospitality industry is resilient and continues to offer dynamic opportunities for upward mobility, and Hyatt is no exception.<p><br></p><strong>How We Care For Our People</strong><p><br></p>Our purpose sets us apart—to care for people so they can be their best. Every business decision is made through the lens of our purpose, and it informs how we have and will continue to support each other as members of the Hyatt family. Our care for our colleagues is the key to our success. We’re proud to have earned a place on Fortune’s prestigious 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the last ten years. This recognition is a testament to the tremendous way our Hyatt family continues to come together to care for one another, our commitment to a culture of inclusivity, empathy, and respect, and making sure everyone feels like they belong.<p><br></p><strong>We’re proud to offer exceptional corporate benefits which include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Annual allotment of free hotel stays at Hyatt hotels globally</li><li>Flexible work schedule and location</li><li>Work-life benefits including well-being initiatives such as a complimentary Headspace subscription, and a discount at the on-site fitness center</li><li>A global family assistance policy with paid time off following the birth or adoption of a child as well as financial assistance for adoption</li><li>Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>Our success is underpinned by our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and we are committed to diversity across the board—from whom we hire and develop, the organizations we support, and whom we buy from and work with.<p><br></p>Being part of Hyatt means always having space to be you. Our global teams are a mosaic of cultures, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, and identities. We constantly strive to reflect the world we care for with teams that achieve and grow together. To learn more about our commitments to DE&amp;I, please visit the Why Hyatt section of the Hyatt career page.<p><br></p><strong>Who You Are</strong><p><br></p>As our ideal candidate, you understand the power and purpose of our Culture of Care and embody our core values of Empathy, Inclusion, Integrity, Experimentation, Respect, and Well-being. You enjoy working with others, are results-driven, and are looking for a variety of opportunities to develop personally and professionally.<p><br></p><strong>The Role </strong><p><br></p>The Developer role requires a wide and varied skill base, an understanding of local hotel markets, ability to develop relationships and convince developers that Hyatt products are well-suited for the location and market.<p><br></p><ul><li>Develop relationships with possible franchises &amp; other partners to grow the Hyatt system with a focus on Hyatt Studios</li><li>Identify locations and markets in which to focus time and effort</li><li>Prepare and analyze market and performance data to demonstrate why the Hyatt Studios brand is the right fit for a market</li><li>Bring new Hyatt projects forward for approval through Hyatt’s internal Select Development Committee</li><li>Negotiate terms and conditions of each franchise agreement</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Experience Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5 + years of hotel franchise sales and development, hotel feasibility, hotel financial analysis or other sales-related experience.</li></ul><p><br></p>Established relationships with owners, operators, consultants, management companies, lenders, builders, etc.<p><br></p><ul><li>Strong negotiation and influencing skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor.</li><li>Ability to multi-task and handle multiple relationships and deals</li><li>Ability to travel approximately 75% of the time</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience Preferred:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Hotel Management, Real Estate, or Finance</li></ul><p><br></p>The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.<p><br></p><strong>We welcome you:</strong><p><br></p>Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. Unsure if you check every box, but feeling inspired to enhance your career? Apply. We’d love to consider your unique experiences and how you could make Hyatt even better.

Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary.<p><br></p><strong>We welcome you:</strong><p><br></p>Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. title: Developer, Southeast
description: <strong>Work with Fortune Global 500 :: New Job Opportunity :: Systems Engineer :: Chicago, IL :: Onsite.</strong><p><br></p><strong>Description:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This Support position in Client's Digital Technology Command Center requires on-site shift work providing 7/24 operational support via pro-active monitoring. </li><li>As part of the Application Recovery Team (ART), this position supports monitoring for Digital Channels, Production environments, Application Health, Distributed system support in Unix/Linux, Windows, Virtual (VMWare, Hyper V), Middleware and AWS Cloud environments. </li><li>Responsible for monitoring day to day application performance and availability, systems performance and analysis of alerts from various tools and restoration of services. </li><li>Familiarity with standard concepts, practices and procedures within IT Operational Support. </li><li>Relies on experience and judgment to plan for shift workload and participate in planned change activities as well as incident follow-ups. </li><li>Creatively managing multiple alerts and incidents to ensure high impacting scenarios are prioritized appropriately and addressed quickly to reduce system impact. </li><li>Being able to correlate events from various tools to assess appropriate level of impact. </li></ul> <strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for providing day to day support for Application recovery and availability, Digital Channels, System Administration via pro-active monitoring for Windows and UNIX/Linux (HPUX, AIX, Solaris, Linux) environments. </li><li>Understanding of various Microsoft tools is a plus. Additional monitoring and support required for critical processes in Cloud, Virtualization, Middleware, Database, Storage and Backup areas. </li><li>Troubleshooting and familiarity with various Middleware components (Messaging technology, WebLogic, WebSphere, DataPower) is essential. </li><li>Strong knowledge of Enterprise Monitoring Tools such as AppDynamics, Big Panda, New Relic, Google Analytics, SCOM and SiteScope is critical. </li><li>Familiarity with Incident Ticketing System (ServiceNow) is a plus. </li><li>Responding to alerts from the enterprise monitoring tools, automation and escalation from IT Service Desk. </li><li>Work with cross-functional teams throughout IT to isolate and resolve unplanned outages. </li><li>Strong working knowledge of ITIL Service Management is required. </li><li>Be able to follow Change, Incident and Problem Management activities. </li><li>Solid verbal and written communication with other technical teams and the business. </li><li>Able to work well with Application support, DevOps, Digital Operations Center, Server Operations, Network Operations, Middleware and Database Support teams (on-shore &amp; off-shore), being able to respond to user reported issues. </li><li>Pro-actively identify any issues with application functionality, abnormalities in digital channel performance, server hardware and software to ensure stability and availability 24X7X365. </li><li>Ensure enterprise standards and security are maintained and enforced on hardware and software. </li><li>Quickly and effectively support incident response process, provide troubleshooting expertise using various monitoring tools during incidents, engage in problem management follow-up and implement improvements to prevent similar incidents. </li></ul> Pay Range: $45-$55/Hr<p><br></p>The specific compensation for this position will be determined by a number of factors, including the scope, complexity and location of the role as well as the cost of labor in the market; the skills, education, training, credentials and experience of the candidate; and other conditions of employment.<p><br></p>Our full-time consultants have access to benefits including medical, dental, vision as well as 401K contributions."<p><br></p>

title: Developer, Northeast/Mid-Atlantic
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States only</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $125 – $150/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Short term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong><strong>Skills<br></strong></strong><ul><li>Deep knowledge and hands-on experience with network security, particularly in AWS </li><li>Experience working with SOCII/HIPAA security compliance </li><li>Knowledge of third-party security tools for intrusion detection </li><li>Experience with AWS config, particularly with AWS Linux OS </li><li>Experience with WAF protecting Cloudfront and API Gateway </li><li>Advanced terraform knowledge and experience in a multi-module, multi-environment structure </li><li>Experience with Vanta (desired) or other automated compliance platforms </li><li>CISSP or AWS Security Specialty Certification (desired) </li></ul> <strong><strong>Project goals<br></strong></strong><ul><li>Integrating an Intrusion Detection Tool into our client's AWS environment with proper alarming and notifications </li><li>Improving the network design and policies and introducing NACLs to further protect their systems, e.g. establishing TRUST and UNTRUST rules </li><li>Integrating a few existing EC2 instances into AWS Config with proper baselines and patching </li><li>Enable WAF to defend our client's web/mobile applications in CloudFront and APIs backed by API Gateway and ALB/NLB from attacks including cross-scripting </li><li>Improving security groups and IAM roles to limit exposure </li><li>Configuring advanced security in AWS cognito to defend against compromised credentials </li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>Our client is looking for a Cloud Security Engineer contractor to help us remediate known security vulnerabilities and implement improvements to their AWS environment to align with their security policies and generally improve the security policies. This project will last 1 to 2 months to prepare for upcoming SOCII/HIPAA compliance audit and could possibly extend further if desired through audit and to help implement more improvements to the policies going forward.<br><br>The company works with PHI data including health insurance claims in the cloud, so security is extremely important to us and their users who trust us to store this sensitive data.<br><br>They operate on AWS using terraform as their IaaC and have generally followed best architecture practices for security but are looking for someone to help accelerate the implementation of their project and guide us with additional expertise of security on what other things they should address to protect their systems from attacks. They have a running product serving thousands of end users and have a fully operational cloud architecture inside a VPC with monitoring and alerting capabilities, so this project would not be starting from scratch and would need to be implemented without impacting service levels.<br><br><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6619<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: System Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Employer: </strong>DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title</strong>: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong> Riverwoods, Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) by using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills and contribute to or lead technology communities. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements: </strong>Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field and 3 years of experience in Database Administrator or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills: </strong>Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: working with database performance tuning to improve query performance; performing database upgrades, migration, and patching; utilizing scripting and automation; Working with database high availability and DR replication; working with database security; working with application developers to troubleshoot database issues; and utilizing Oracle Exadata Platform.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.</em><p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between to . Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Solutions Engineer
description: Trident Consulting is seeking a <strong> "Senior Data &amp; Integration Engineer" </strong>for one of our clients in <strong> Chicago- IL</strong>. A global leader in business and technology services<p><br></p><strong>Role: Senior Data &amp; Integration Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago- IL</strong><p><br></p><strong>Type: Contract </strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Job Summary</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> A Bachelor's degree in Information Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a quantitative discipline in science, business, or social science.</li><li> A minimum of 5-7+ years of relevant experience.</li><li> Strong computer science fundamentals.</li><li> Excellent technical, analytical, and organizational skills.</li><li> Effective written and verbal communication skills, including technical writing.</li><li> Experience as a data developer using Python, Kafka, Spark Streaming, Azure SQL Server, Cosmos DB/Mongo DB, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Search, etc.</li><li> Experience in building and maintaining APIs and developing integration patterns based on API technologies and event-based messages.</li><li> Experience handling unstructured data, working in a data lake environment, leveraging data streaming, and developing data pipelines driven by events/queues.</li><li> Hands-on engineering leadership skills, with a curiosity about technology, adaptability to change, and understanding of the technologies supporting areas such as Cloud Computing (AWS, Azure preferred), Micro Services, Streaming Technologies, Network, Security, etc.</li><li> Proven reliability, self-motivation, and self-discipline, with the capability to execute on multiple projects simultaneously within a fast-paced environment, working with cross-functional teams.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Some Of Our Recent Awards Include</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 2022, 2021, 2020 Inc. 5000 fastest-growing private companies in America</li><li> 2022, 2021 SF Business Times 100 fastest-growing private companies in Bay</li></ul><p><br></p><em>Area</em>

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies – the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.<p><br></p>WorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to think openly about problems, balancing intellectualism and practicality. Excellent ideas come from anyone, anywhere. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess an attitude of continuous improvement.<p><br></p>Our goal is to hire the best and the brightest. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an outstanding talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us build it.<p><br></p>Technologists at WorldQuant research, design, code, test and deploy firmwide platforms and tooling while working collaboratively with researchers and portfolio managers. Our environment is relaxed yet intellectually driven. We seek people who think in code and are motivated by being around like-minded people.<p><br></p><strong>The Role:</strong> WorldQuant is seeking exceptional C++ developers to join our front office development team to further enhance and build our next generation trading platforms.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Write low latency, high throughput C++ code</li><li>Implement mission critical trading infrastructure</li><li>Work with portfolio managers to implement new trading systems</li><li>Adapt existing systems to our next generation trading platform</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Bring</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A minimum of 4 years of writing high performance C++</li><li>Modern C++ knowledge (C++17/20, etc)</li><li>C++ template meta programming knowledge</li><li>Possess in-depth knowledge of network programming and distributed computing</li><li>Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux fundamentals</li><li>Strong understanding of data structures and algorithms</li><li>Finance experience is preferred but not required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Locations:</strong> Chicago, NYC, CT, or Austin<p><br></p>WorldQuant is a total compensation organization where you will be eligible for a base salary, discretionary performance bonus, and benefits. The estimated salary range for this position is $125,000 to $250,000 which is specific to New York and may change in the future. When finalizing an offer we will take into consideration an individual’s experience level and the qualifications they bring to the role to formulate a competitive total compensation package.<p><br></p>By submitting this application, you acknowledge and consent to terms of the WorldQuant Privacy Policy. The privacy policy offers an explanation of how and why your data will be collected, how it will be used and disclosed, how it will be retained and secured, and what legal rights are associated with that data (including the rights of access, correction, and deletion). The policy also describes legal and contractual limitations on these rights. The specific rights and obligations of individuals living and working in different areas may vary by jurisdiction.<p><br></p>Copyright © 2023 WorldQuant, LLC. All Rights Reserved.<p><br></p>WorldQuant is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation or preference, age, marital status, citizenship, national origin, disability, military status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, or any other protected characteristic as established by applicable law.

We seek people who think in code and are motivated by being around like-minded people.<p><br></p><strong>The Role:</strong> WorldQuant is seeking exceptional C++ developers to join our front office development team to further enhance and build our next generation trading platforms.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Write low latency, high throughput C++ code</li><li>Implement mission critical trading infrastructure</li><li>Work with portfolio managers to implement new trading systems</li><li>Adapt existing systems to our next generation trading platform</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Bring</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A minimum of 4 years of writing high performance C++</li><li>Modern C++ knowledge (C++17/20, etc)</li><li>C++ template meta programming knowledge</li><li>Possess in-depth knowledge of network programming and distributed computing</li><li>Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux fundamentals</li><li>Strong understanding of data structures and algorithms</li><li>Finance experience is preferred but not required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Locations:</strong> Chicago, NYC, CT, or Austin<p><br></p>WorldQuant is a total compensation organization where you will be eligible for a base salary, discretionary performance bonus, and benefits. The estimated salary range for this position is $125,000 to $250,000 which is specific to New York and may change in the future. When finalizing an offer we will take into consideration an individual’s experience level and the qualifications they bring to the role to formulate a competitive total compensation package.<p><br></p>By submitting this application, you acknowledge and consent to terms of the WorldQuant Privacy Policy. The privacy policy offers an explanation of how and why your data will be collected, how it will be used and disclosed, how it will be retained and secured, and what legal rights are associated with that data (including the rights of access, correction, and deletion). The policy also describes legal and contractual limitations on these rights. The specific rights and obligations of individuals living and working in different areas may vary by jurisdiction.<p><br></p>Copyright © 2023 WorldQuant, LLC. All Rights Reserved.<p><br></p>WorldQuant is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation or preference, age, marital status, citizenship, national origin, disability, military status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, or any other protected characteristic as established by applicable law.

title: Junior computer Programmer
description: <p><em><strong>Job title: Engineer III<br><br></strong></em></p><p><em><strong>Location:</strong></em><strong> <em>Remote (US)<br><br></em></strong></p><p> <br><br></p><p>Responsible for the delivery of end to end system development and maintenance on complex technology systems within assigned client group, business unit or corporate department. <br><br></p><p><br><strong>Primary duties may include, but are not limited to: <br></strong>* Development on medium to large complex customer technology platforms or architectures. <br>* Maintains active relationships with internal and/or external stakeholder to develop business requirements. <br>* Analyzes and classifies complex change request and identifies and documents possible system code enhancements. <br>* Demonstrates knowledge of industry trends, our products and infrastructure. <br>* Collaborates with engineers and graphic designers, analyzes and classifies complex change request and reviews and evaluates possible enhancements. <br>* Works with development team to develop and define application scope and objectives and prepare functional and/or technical specifications. <br>* Analyzes and evaluates detailed business and technical requirements. <br>* Understands the product and analytics and drive requirements that take into account stakeholders needs. Identifies problems/risks. <br>* Codes and maintains complex components of information systems. <br>* Mentors others on coding standards and performs code reviews. <br>* Reviews test cases and advises QA on adjacent code/regression impact. <br>* Develops and performs system testing and fixes defects identified during testing and re-executes unit tests to validate results. <br>* Aids in integrating activities with other IT departments for successful implementation and support of project efforts. <br>* Provides on call support and monitors the system and identifies system deficiencies. <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p><em><strong>Required Qualifications: <br><br></strong></em></p><p>* Requires an BA/BS degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or related field of study <br>* Minimum of 3 years' experience on one platform, multi database, multi-language or multi business application; or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:<br><br></strong></p><p><strong>* </strong>Experience mentoring others, leading small projects and providing troubleshooting support is strongly preferred.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p><em><strong>Preferred Skillsets - Backend Focus: <br><br></strong></em></p><ul><li><p>Java 11 +<br><br></p></li><li><p>Angular 2+<br><br></p></li><li><p>Spring Boot 2<br><br></p></li><li><p>MS SQL Server<br><br></p></li><li><p>ORM (Hibernate, eBean)<br><br></p></li><li><p>Docker/Kubernetes<br><br></p></li><li><p>Design patterns<br><br></p></li><li><p>Junit<br><br></p></li><li><p>Git<br><br></p></li><li><p>Linux OS<br><br></p></li></ul><p> <br><br><br></p><strong>Desired Skills and Experience<br><br></strong>Responsible for the delivery of end to end system development and maintenance on complex technology systems within assigned client group, business unit or corporate department. <br><br><br><br><p><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team<br><br></strong></p><br><p>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities - and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<br><br></p><br><p>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<br><br></p><br><p>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide - and Elevance Health approves - a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<br><br></p><br><p>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World's Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.<br><br></p>

title: Senior Data & Integration Engineer
description: <strong>About Oakton College :</strong><p><br></p>For 50 years, Oakton College has been the setting where thousands begin or continue their college or career studies. Educating people of all ages, from all walks of life and from more than 40 nations, Oakton focuses on improving the quality of life for everyone who enters its doors.<p><br></p>We offer:<p><br></p>Continuing education<p><br></p>Great benefits<p><br></p>Paid winter break<p><br></p>FRIDAYS OFF during the summer<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Basic Functions and Responsibilities:</strong></u><p><br></p>Under general supervision, provide support for Windows and Macintosh desktop clients and packaged administrative and academic applications running on desktops, laptops, local servers, and the cloud. Support is provided through identification, evaluation, purchase, installation and post installation.<p><br></p><u><strong>Characteristics, Duties and Responsibilities:</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>Create, manage and automate the deployment of applications, scripts, and packages using SCCM, Jamf, InstallShield and other tools.</li><li>Configure, deploy and maintain Windows and Macintosh desktop clients, including building and maintaining operating system images, resolving issues, and monitoring performance.</li><li>Implement and manage security compliance of Windows and Macintosh desktop clients and applications. Research, plan, and deploy vulnerability patches and software security updates.</li><li>Provide tier 2/3 technical applications support for the IT helpdesk and other IT teams. Work with other IT Department employees to facilitate installation, troubleshooting, and support.</li><li>Working with the Data Center staff, install, upgrade, and maintain application servers supporting Windows and Macintosh desktops (licensing, SCCM, WSUS, etc.).</li><li>Working with the Data Center staff, configure and install multi-tier packaged Server or Cloud based applications.</li><li>Perform Active Directory administration functions related to desktop systems and applications including Group Policy, user and group provisioning, and user and file share permissions.</li><li>Generate and maintain documentation about software installation, configuration inventory, and technical support.</li><li>Utilize programming skills to create and modify scripts and configuration files for optimal system performance and automation.</li><li>Perform other job-related duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Qualifications and Working Conditions:</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree with specific course work in Computer Science or an equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities can be acquired.</li><li>Excellent communications skills both verbal and written are required.</li><li>Strong team work, attention to details and organizational skills are required.</li><li>Two years of experience with Microsoft Windows Active Directory is required. Experience with System Center Configuration Manager is preferred.</li><li>Two years of experience with Windows 10/11 operating systems is required</li><li>Two years of experience with deploying operating systems and applications in a Microsoft Windows environment is preferred.</li><li>Programming Skills in PowerShell or other scripting languages is preferred.</li><li>Ability to interact professionally and tactfully with people of different levels of education, cultural backgrounds, and life experiences, and to exhibit an adequate level of respect to fellow employees and the College community at large is required.</li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong>Physical Demands:</strong></u><p><br></p>Light lifting up to 10 lbs. and light carrying up to 10 lbs. Ability to reach above shoulder. Periods of time spent sitting, standing, walking, kneeling, bending and stooping. Mobility to move from building to building on-Campus and to visit off-Campus entities. Work is performed in a general office environment and is sedentary in nature. Little or no exposure to adverse working conditions.<p><br></p><strong> Additional Information:</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>Supervision Received:</strong></u><p><br></p>Administrative and functional supervision is received from the Director of Systems and Network Services.<p><br></p><u><strong>Supervision Exercised:</strong></u><p><br></p>None.<p><br></p><strong>HOURS - </strong>Monday - Friday - 8:15 am - 5:00 pm<p><br></p><strong>SALARY:</strong> $65,958<p><br></p>Based on the needs of the college and with Administrator approval, some positions at the college may have remote or hybrid schedule options available. Please note, that during the 65 working day probationary period, employees are required to report to campus.<p><br></p>Oakton is accessible by public transportation<p><br></p><strong> Application Instructions:</strong><p><br></p>For further details, visit our website at www.oakton.edu and select the Employment link to view Employment Opportunities.<p><br></p>Please be sure to have a current resume, cover letter, and list of, at least, three (3) professional references with contact information prepared to submit with your application.<p><br></p>Oakton College is an equal opportunity, affirmative action institution, committed to employing competent, qualified individuals. Oakton College does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, disability, age, marital status, military status, socioeconomic status, sex or gender, gender identity, or sexual orientation in admission to and participation in its educational programs, college activities and services, or in its employment practices.<p><br></p>Posted positions may be removed from the Oakton website without notice when it is determined that no additional applicants are required.<p><br></p><strong>URL: </strong> www.oakton.edu

or any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:<br><br></strong></p><p><strong>* </strong>Experience mentoring others, leading small projects and providing troubleshooting support is strongly preferred.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p><em><strong>Preferred Skillsets - Backend Focus: <br><br></strong></em></p><ul><li><p>Java 11 +<br><br></p></li><li><p>Angular 2+<br><br></p></li><li><p>Spring Boot 2<br><br></p></li><li><p>MS SQL Server<br><br></p></li><li><p>ORM (Hibernate, eBean)<br><br></p></li><li><p>Docker/Kubernetes<br><br></p></li><li><p>Design patterns<br><br></p></li><li><p>Junit<br><br></p></li><li><p>Git<br><br></p></li><li><p>Linux OS<br><br></p></li></ul><p> <br><br><br></p><strong>Desired Skills and Experience<br><br></strong>Responsible for the delivery of end to end system development and maintenance on complex technology systems within assigned client group, business unit or corporate department. <br><br><br><br><p><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team<br><br></strong></p><br><p>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities - and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<br><br></p><br><p>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<br><br></p><br><p>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide - and Elevance Health approves - a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<br><br></p><br><p>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World's Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.<br><br></p>

title: Entry Level Software Engineer
description: <strong>Company Overview<br><br></strong>At Motorola Solutions, we believe that everything starts with safety. It’s the constant that empowers people to confidently move forward. It can fill a flight or sell out a stadium. It can care for a patient or graduate a class.<br><br>As a global leader in public safety and enterprise security, we create and connect the technologies that help to keep people safe where they live, learn, work and play. Our integrated technology ecosystem unifies critical communications, video security and access control, and command center software, enabling collaboration in more powerful ways.<br><br>At Motorola Solutions, we’re ushering in a new era in public safety and security. Bring your passion, potential and talents to a career that matters.<br><br><strong>Department Overview<br><br></strong>Our customers are public safety agencies, governments and military organizations who use our mission critical communications systems. The Security Update Service team, part of the Motorola Solutions cybersecurity services organization, protects mission critical systems by ensuring security updates are verified, tested, and installed.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>As a systems software engineer, you will be responsible for vetting security updates, developing, testing, deploying, and documenting automation solution(s) for mission critical systems. The automation solution(s) will be utilized by various teams to validate and apply software and operating systems updates. Due to the nature of the various environments, the solution(s) will be clientless.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Certifying Security Updates for use on Motorola Solutions Products</li><li>Experience with version control software (i.e. Git, BitBucket). </li><li>Communicate with different team members within and outside the organization to resolve defects/issues</li><li>Develop clientless solutions to automate the delivery of patches and updates for Windows and Linux based operating systems, VMware solutions, and other technologies</li><li>Troubleshoot system and network issues that result from updates </li><li>Provide reporting on the status of running systems, applications, and updates </li><li>Work with other teams to understand processes and look for ways to improve them via automation</li><li>Hands on experience with Windows and Linux operating systems </li><li>High level knowledge of an automation/deployment/configuration solution like (ansible, puppet, chef, jenkins, etc)</li><li>High level knowledge of networking concepts (i.e. network devices, IP addresses, ports, and protocols)</li><li>High level knowledge of virtualization concepts (VMWare ESXI)</li><li>Experience performing troubleshooting, break fix, or technical support on Windows or Linux operating systems </li><li>Experience using SharePoint, Jira, or other project tracking systems</li><li>Must have strong organizational skills <br><br></li></ul><strong>Basic Requirements<br></strong><ul><li>Experience in one or more programming/scripting language (C, C++, C#, Shell, Powershell, Bash, Node.js, etc)</li><li>Due to the nature of some federal contracts, US Citizenship is required. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Travel Requirements<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Relocation Provided<br><br></strong>None<br><br><strong>Position Type<br><br></strong>New Grad<br><br><strong>Referral Payment Plan<br><br></strong>Yes<br><br><strong>Our U.S. Benefits include:<br></strong><ul><li>Incentive Bonus Plans</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision benefits</li><li>401K with Company Match</li><li>9 Paid Holidays</li><li>Generous Paid Time Off Packages</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li><li>Paid Parental &amp; Family Leave</li><li>and more!<br><br></li></ul><em><strong>EEO Statement<br><br></strong></em>Motorola Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran's status, or, any other protected characteristic.<br><br>

title: Remote - Engineer III
description: <p><strong>Support a startup ensuring students with disabilities get teachers 🎓</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>House of Light </strong>is dedicated to tackling the teacher shortage crisis for students with disabilities especially for those with visual impairments. They offer specialized training programs, mentorship opportunities, and competitive incentives to attract and retain highly skilled educators in this field. House of Light is an active advocate for inclusivity and raises awareness among corporate organizations regarding the need for disability inclusion that starts at the education level 🇺🇸</p><p><br></p><ul><li>They are looking for a <strong>Web Development </strong>VOLUNTEER to help write website content for each page of the website and support in revising their site, which they are currently using Wix.</li><li>Volunteer 4-6 hours per week remotely 💻</li></ul><p>️</p><p><strong>If you have these skills and want to make change happen, apply to volunteer with House of Light now!</strong></p>

title: Endpoint Systems Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>The Front-End Web Developer reports to the Manager – Digital Experience and is responsible for the plan, design, and development of web pages that engage B2B customers, provide relevant content, and drive desired actions. Maintain and provide ongoing design of external website pages, content delivery, email marketing, lead capturing, and user interface. Ensure S&amp;C’s web presence strategy and branding guidelines are adhered to. Work with senior stakeholders throughout the company to develop clear, effective, and data-informed page design and presentation of content. Continually track website performance with data analytics tools and regularly report important KPI information to leadership and stakeholders.<br><br>This position requires a creative and technically skilled web designer/developer who has a passion for understanding complex ideas and breaking them down into powerful messages.<br><br><strong>The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to, the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Lead S&amp;C’s web presence strategy to improve the user experience, including functionality, design, and usability.</li><li>Create, update, edit and test web pages using the web content management system (CMS). Train stakeholders on using the CMS.</li><li>Create wireframes/prototypes, site maps, user flows, and functional requirement documentation for new webpages as needed.</li><li>Create intuitive user interfaces focused on customer experience and progression.</li><li>Use cascading style sheets (CSS) that are consistent across all browsers and platforms.</li><li>Document components and assist back-end web developer through implementation.</li><li>Collaborate with back-end web developer to promote and achieve optimal solutions.</li><li>Use analytics to track website performance and report relevant information to stakeholders. Identify and fix website speed performance and accessibility problems in real-time. Analyze data, processes, and codes to troubleshoot problems and identify areas for improvement.</li><li>Manage international webpage process with both internal regional business units and external translation services vendors.</li><li>Work with stakeholders to develop web content that will resonate with visitors.</li><li>Manage S&amp;C’s web-to-lead process and reports to leadership and stakeholders on key metrics.</li><li>Manage S&amp;C’s marketing automation tool, Pardot, as it relates to website and email marketing campaigns.</li><li>Manage, audit, and actively improve search engine optimization (SEO) to align with industry standards.</li><li>Stay up to date on recent technologies to evolve S&amp;C’s web presence.</li><li>Maintain graphic standards and branding throughout web presence.<br></li></ul><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Four-year degree in Web Design/Development, Information Technology or related field</li><li>3+ years relevant experience</li><li>Strong knowledge in HTML/HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery. SCSS/LESS experience a plus. </li><li>Working knowledge of C#, ASP.NET and .NET a plus.</li><li>Strong knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite (Adobe XD, Dreamweaver, Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator)</li><li>Strong knowledge of Google Analytics, including interpreting data and reporting </li><li>Strong knowledge of browser DOM and basic HTTP request/response lifecycles</li><li>Working knowledge of source control tools such as Git, Bitbucket, etc.</li><li>Ability to envision and execute powerful web page design </li><li>Expertise in MS Office software (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)</li><li>Experience with Optimizely (EPiServer) or a similar web content management system</li><li>Experience with SalesForce.com and Pardot a plus</li><li>B2B website experience a plus</li><li>Marketing automation or account based marketing experience a plus</li><li>A link to your portfolio or past work examples is required to be considered<br></li></ul>
industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Utilities

title: Remote - Engineer III
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<br><br><strong>Store Code: </strong>Infrastructure-Network (5118708)<br><br>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company’s 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<br><br><strong>Primary Purpose:<br><br></strong>A Platform Engineer will provide expertise and leadership in the design, configuration, and management of all corporate, distribution center and retail digital media devices and associated supporting services. They are expected to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment leveraging forward-thinking technical engineering expertise in the media device and services area of the enterprise.<br><br><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li> Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of technology solutions to meet business needs</li><li> Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap</li><li> Accountable for projects/applications/infrastructure meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost-effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.</li><li> Ensures project artifacts are developed as required, this includes working with support organizations and suppliers to ensure proper documentation is created and stored in the procedure’s manual or document repository.</li><li> Facilitates/completes the creation of communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.</li><li> Develops complete and robust test plans, cases, and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved and user acceptance is obtained. Ensures the test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.</li><li> Acts as communication point keeping the supplier and business partners informed of infrastructure changes, application changes, data changes or upcoming implementations and ensures business specific impacts are addressed.</li><li> Ensures integration and consideration of assigned business areas against critical business processing, freeze periods, schedule changes, weather events and significant refresh activities.</li><li> Thorough understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets, and key stakeholders.</li><li> Review business processes to understand the capability gaps and opportunities</li><li> Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications</li><li> Builds close relationships with the function heads and their teams. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Master's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field.</li><li> Equivalent training/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered.</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.<br><br></li></ul>#DICEJobs<br><br>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<br><br>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<br><br>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com.<br><br>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com.<br><br>Job Requisition: 317752_external_USA-IL-Chicago_5252023<br><br>

title: Systems Software Engineer
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<br><br><strong>Store Code: </strong>Infrastructure-Network (5118718)<br><br>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company’s 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<br><br><strong>Primary Purpose: <br><br></strong>A Platform Engineer will provide expertise and leadership in the design, configuration, and management of all corporate, distribution center and retail digital media devices and associated supporting services. They are expected to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment leveraging forward-thinking technical engineering expertise in the media device and services area of the enterprise.<br><br>Duties and Responsibilities:<br><ul><li> Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of technology solutions to meet business needs</li><li> Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap</li><li> Accountable for projects/applications/infrastructure meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost-effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.</li><li> Ensures project artifacts are developed as required, this includes working with support organizations and suppliers to ensure proper documentation is created and stored in the procedure’s manual or document repository.</li><li> Facilitates/completes the creation of communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.</li><li> Develops complete and robust test plans, cases, and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved and user acceptance is obtained. Ensures the test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.</li><li> Acts as communication point keeping the supplier and business partners informed of infrastructure changes, application changes, data changes or upcoming implementations and ensures business specific impacts are addressed.</li><li> Ensures integration and consideration of assigned business areas against critical business processing, freeze periods, schedule changes, weather events and significant refresh activities.</li><li> Thorough understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets, and key stakeholders.</li><li> Review business processes to understand the capability gaps and opportunities</li><li> Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications</li><li> Builds close relationships with the function heads and their teams. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Master's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field.</li><li> Equivalent training/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered.</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.<br><br></li></ul>Preferred Qualifications:<br><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.<br><br></li></ul>#DICEJobs<br><br>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field and master's degree in Technology and/or Business-related field</li><li> equivalent trainings/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.</li><li> 2 or more years of equivalent experience in an advanced role or technical capacity, leading teams directly or indirectly.</li><li> 2 or more years' experience directly responsible for guiding, training or onboarding team members in relevant technologies, capabilities or skills<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications:<br></strong><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> 3 or more years experience in Agile teams and Product/Platform based operating model.</li><li> 3 or more years of experience in leading teams or advancing technical capability in teams.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.<br><br></li></ul>#DICEJobs<br><br>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<br><br>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<br><br>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com.<br><br>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com.<br><br>Job Requisition: 317759_external_USA-IL-Chicago_5242023<br><br>

title: IT Engineer Platform
description: Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company’s new website at: http://www.WabtecCorp.com.<p><br></p>It’s not just about your career… or your job title…it’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters…do things that haven’t been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.<p><br></p><strong>Role Summary:</strong><p><br></p>The Lead Systems Engineer leads locomotive modernization, NPI kits, Software, and Control Electronics Obsolescence projects with broad scope and high impact to the business. In this role you will be responsible for assignments with long-term business implications, manage different complexity issues, drive the overall projects coordination and execution. The Lead Systems Engineer’s focus is to interpret and communicate system level customer product requirements and/or internal business requirements to supporting subsystems, working to identify and drive solutions to interface issues and validate that they are met through the design review process. In this role you will lead projects from conception to customer delivery by being the primary engineering interface between the product, commercial program management, engineering design, validation, and production/field implementation teams.<p><br></p><strong>Essential Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Ability to excel in a lean mission-based team environment though optimized designs, validation scope, and customer focused results</li><li> Provide technical leadership for all product design aspects of the assigned NPI, Software, Control Electronics Obsolescence and/or locomotive modernization projects</li><li> Develop and maintain projects schedule, engage necessary engineering resources for successful execution</li><li> Analyze and identify project risks and develop/implement mitigation plan</li><li> Deliver strong and concise requirements and product definition to supporting engineering teams</li><li> Provide analysis of overall system design with focus on design rigor and practical improvements</li><li> Knowledge of engineering processes and tools used to create system level documentation (QSW, DOORS, EDOT, PLM, Reliance, etc)</li><li> Organizing and performing system level validation plans on products</li><li> Support and coordinate with interfacing organizations such as commercial, proposals, manufacturing, sourcing, services, reliability, global engineering, and systems engineering</li><li> Support service programs, fulfillment, and New Product Introduction (NPI)</li><li> Support customer delivery and commissioning, on-site or remotely</li><li> Communicate progress to all levels of the organization</li><li> Mentor and develop less experienced personnel<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications/ Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor of Science in Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, or Computer Science</li><li> At least 5 years of engineering projects execution experience, preferably in railways industry</li><li> Systems approach and analytical mindset</li><li> Project planning and organizational skills<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired Characteristics:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Master’s degree in Engineering</li><li> Six Sigma training</li><li> Strong electrical/mechanical design and analytical background</li><li> Familiarity with manufacturing processes</li><li> Ability to drive projects to completion</li><li> Strong oral and written communication skills</li><li> Strong interpersonal and leadership skills</li><li> Ability to interface effectively with all levels of the organization and external customers</li><li> North America and International legacy locomotive expertise<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Wabtec Corporation is committed to taking on the world’s toughest challenges. In order to fulfill that commitment we rely on a culture of leadership, diversity and inclusiveness. We aim to employ the world’s brightest minds to help us create a limitless source of ideas and opportunities. We believe in hiring talented people of varied backgrounds, experiences and styles…people like you! Wabtec Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or protected Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: IT Engineer Platform
description: <strong>#23-03242</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Title:</strong> Business Analyst<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> Northbrook, IL 60062<p><br></p><strong>End-Client:</strong> Large Pharma Company<p><br></p><strong>Pay:</strong> $79 - $89/hr. with comprehensive benefits (401K, Health, Dental, &amp; Vision)<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> 9 - month contract<p><br></p><strong>100% virtual opportunity</strong><p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Collaborate with and leverage analytical expertise to support marketing and other internal partners to prioritize, develop, and improve upon key reporting metrics and performance indicators around brand objectives to enable better and more informed business decisions.</li><li> Design and manage projects applying analytics techniques to conduct rigorous analyses to uncover new business opportunities and insights and to support the development of actionable strategic and tactical recommendations based on the findings.</li><li> Apply best practices to design, efficiently conduct, and strategically align ad hoc analyses as needed to support evolving business requirements and to provide timely business insights.</li><li> Collaborate with and mobilize other operational stakeholders to define, develop and maintain business rules and data models in alignment with internal policies and business needs.</li><li> Manage, and support collaboration with marketing sciences and other analytical, reporting, and business functions on promotional initiatives ROI assessments and other measurements of promotional effectiveness.</li><li> Maintain high degree of proficiency among data systems, programs, and software resources, support data quality control and acquisition and maintenance of ad hoc analytical environments, to ensure optimal and efficient achievement of department objectives</li><li> Analyze pharmacy claims and other syndicated data to extract actionable insights using various analytics techniques.</li><li> Develop and execute on brand performance measurement plans</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree in Business related field or the sciences with courses focused on quantitative techniques.</li><li> Minimum 5 years of progressively expanding experience in analytics, including data manipulation, statistically rigorous analysis, and marketing analytics within the pharmaceutical or healthcare related industry.</li><li> Possess strong interpersonal skills and demonstrated ability to effectively interact with and influence all levels of employees including senior management.</li><li> Proven ability to thrive in fast-paced, team environment, adapt to changing priorities, and independently lead cross-functional projects of high complexity.</li><li> Demonstrated experience working with various business intelligence and data visualization tools.</li><li> Excellent skills in the following areas: project management, organization, written and verbal communication, accuracy, personal initiative, autonomy, and innovation.</li><li> Demonstrated ability in taking initiative to proactively evaluate existing sales strategies and recommend changes, when appropriate.</li><li> Minimum 3 years of experience applying statistics, modeling, and simulation techniques in complex analytical projects to deliver actionable solutions to business questions.</li><li> Knowledge of relational database concepts, proficiency with SQL, experience in R, SAS, or similar language</li><li> Proficiency in MS Excel and Power Point</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Experience with AWS ecosystem.</li><li> Ability to independently design, implement, and validate simulations and models in R, SAS or similar language.</li><li> Advanced degree in quantitative field or equivalent experience with strong business acumen</li><li> Experience working with Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics</li><li> Experience with visualization tools like Qlik View/Qlik Sense and/or Tableau</li><li> Experience in KPI and diagnostic metrics development</li><li> Experience in promotional analytics: HCP non-personal and/or Consumer</li><li> Experience in presenting business insights and providing recommendations</li><li> Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to effectively interact with all levels of employees including senior management.</li></ul>

title: IT Engineer Platform
description: *Position is Bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Company is currently seeking a AWS DevOps Engineer with Kafka experience. Candidate will provide subject matter expertise for ongoing support of third-party tools like Kafka, Artifactory, Terraform, and Apigee.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support the lower environments for incident and problem management</li><li>Resolve complex support issues in non-production environments.</li><li>Have an understanding of Cloud Native applications running on Kubernetes within AWS.</li><li>Assist production support and development staff in debugging environment defects.</li><li>Create procedural and troubleshooting documentation related to cloud native applications</li><li>Write complex automation scripts using common automation tools, such as Jenkins, Ansible, and Terraform</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Systems administration and change management practices</li><li>Message-oriented technologies such as Kafka</li><li>Internet/Web based technologies</li><li>ITLT Best Practices</li><li>Scripting and coding</li><li>Network technologies</li><li>CI/CD tools such as Artifactory, Jenkins, and GIT</li><li>Cloud native applications, including Terraform experience</li><li>Technologies used to support microservices</li><li>Encryption technologies (SSL/TLS, PKI Infrastructure management)</li><li>Security controls as applied to software technologies</li></ul>
