title: IT Engineer Platform
description: We are looking for <strong>Test Data Engineer </strong>for our client in <strong>Richardson, TX / Chicago, IL</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Title: Test Data Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Location: Richardson, TX / Chicago, IL</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Type: Contract</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Pay Range $45hr - $50hr</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This role demonstrates a capable understanding of Test Data Management related to data security, data masking, synthetic data creation and test data strategy planning.</li><li>The engineer will be responsible for working with teams to provide test data.</li><li>This role will create synthetic data, perform data conditioning, macro creations for data generation, data masking, provisioning for data and mask data as needed.</li><li>Strong ability to multi-task in an environment of changing priorities.</li></ul><strong>Responsibilities-</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for working with divisional teams to understand data requests and to create a strategy for delivering the data.</li><li>Expertise in TDM function including Data provisioning, sub setting, profiling, Data mining.</li><li>Ability to perform PHI Analysis for determination of masking.</li><li>Responsible for facilitating/providing test data strategy planning.</li><li>Ability to create synthetic data based on customer request.</li><li>Macro generation for synthetic data creation.</li><li>Capable abilities with TDM masking tools (Informatica preferred).</li><li>Maintains referential integrity and relationships of the masked data.</li><li>Creates and maintains documentation for data masking solutions and processes. Works with application teams to understand the data and identify protected and restricted data.</li><li>Ability to seek out and acquire enhanced skills on cutting-edge test-data management approaches, while championing the adoption of test data management best practices.</li><li>Work directly with QA team members to understand business use cases and help identify test data for short and long-term testing.</li><li>Work with development and business teams to understand application workflows and determine best approaches for test data de-identification.</li><li>Collaborate with Management to design and implement test data strategy and framework.</li><li>Create test data management roadmap for complex applications, with policies to manage them, and ensure enforcement.</li><li>Ability to identify dependencies, constraints and risks as needed for test data planning Ability to handle escalations / project progress concerns from client and manage them according to expectations.</li><li>Scripting experience with Shell, Perl, .bat, VB Script or any other scripting language experience.</li></ul><strong>Must Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>TDM function including Data provisioning, sub setting, profiling, Data mining.</li><li>Ability to perform PHI Analysis for determination of masking.</li><li>Responsible for facilitating/providing test data strategy planning.</li></ul>

title: Engineer - Systems Engineering
description: <strong>Senior Associate, Linux Administration / Engineering</strong><p><br></p>The resume of Ali is attached. We placed him in this position and he has fallen off.<p><br></p>SALARY: $100k- $105k plus 10%<p><br></p><ul><li>Hybrid 2 days in office 3 days remote</li></ul><p><br></p>Looking for a candidate with 3 or more years Linux systems installation operations administration and maintenance of physical and virtualized servers linux shell scripting systems administrator operations support vmware environment aws large enterprise environment<p><br></p><ul><li> Provide advanced system administration, operational support and problem resolution for a large complex Linux computing environment, including both virtualized and physical servers</li><li> Create and Patch AMIs, perform pull requests, write Automation code</li><li> Perform Linux administration including changes, deletes, disk space management, application installation, and backup</li><li> Use your infrastructure and networking knowledge to maintain cloud based infrastructure predominantly on AWS involving EC2, S3, RDS &amp; VPC</li><li> Use configuration management tools (primarily Ansible and Terraform) to build and maintain a hybrid infrastructure hosted both at colocation facilities and in the public cloud.</li><li> Work directly with the development team to build supporting infrastructure for specific new application functionality.</li><li> Run proof of concept projects on early stage infrastructure improvements to validate the feasibility of an approach, evaluate performance, and spike an implementation.</li><li> Review and evaluate virtual and physical server performance and capacity</li><li> Forecast system demands and recommends upgrades, expansions and reconfigurations</li><li> Perform automated computing environment builds, site setup, user training, hardware/software installation, maintenance and support and documentation of operating procedures and processes</li><li> Support VMware environment including changes, adding/removing systems, and disk space management.</li><li> Troubleshoot hardware and software problems, takes appropriate corrective action and/or interact with IT staff or vendors in performing complex testing, support, server recovery, and troubleshooting functions.</li><li> Assist with development and testing of changes needed to maintain DR environment</li><li> Use change management process</li><li> Comply with all audit, compliance, and regulatory requirements</li><li> Attend meetings as a team representative</li><li> Support on call, weekend and off hours work as needed</li><li> Perform other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><strong>Technical Skills: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Extensive knowledge of Linux operating systems, Linux shells and standard utilities, and common Linux security tools</li><li> In depth system administration knowledge and skills for RedHat Linux. Knowledge of Amazon LINUX is a plus.</li><li> Experience with using Github or other version control tools for source code management</li><li> Experience using configuration management tools such as Puppet, Chef, or Ansible and container tools such as Docker</li><li> Ability to write and maintain automation code and scripts and IaaS / Infrastructure as code, such as Terraform</li><li> Familiarity with DevOps activities and using CICD pipeline software to deploy code</li><li> Working knowledge of cloud components and services in AWS or Azure.</li><li> System administration experience and knowledge of VMware and administration of virtual servers</li><li> Grub, PXE boot, Kickstart</li><li> Yum, rpms, Satellite server</li><li> SVM, LVM, Boot from SAN, UFS/ZFS, filesystem configuration</li><li> General working knowledge of NAS, SAN, and networking</li><li> Experience with Github, Ansible, Jenkins and Terraform tools/applications</li><li> Knowledge or experience with DevOps, OpenShift, AWS cloud, or other similar technologies is desirable</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education and/or Experience: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree</li><li> Three or more years’ experience in Linux systems installation, operations, administration, and maintenance of physical and virtualized servers</li></ul>

title: Business Analyst
description: Java Developer<br><br>Chicago, Illinois (Hybrid)<br><br>Phone+Skype<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>Understand business requirements, processes, and specifications required to support implementation.<br><br>Document technical specifications, functional flows, and drive the project autonomously.<br><br>Build and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable code.<br><br>Manage end-to-end development cycle from requirements analysis, coding, testing, and maintenance.<br><br>Assist in analysis of interacting systems to ensure changes made to one system will not impact other systems.<br><br><strong><u>Requirements<br><br></u></strong>More than 5 years' experience Java application development (including JSP), preferably in the financial industry<br><br>Web application programming: e.g. HTML, CSS, Javascript (including JQuery)<br><br>Microsoft SQL Server<br><br>CVS source code versioning/repository<br><br>Working knowledge of Apache Struts 1.x<br><br>Eclipse Java EE IDE for Web Developers<br><br>Working knowledge of IBM Websphere Application Server

title: AWS Kafka DevOps Engineer
description: Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking a ServiceNow Solutions Engineer. Candidate will provide services to an existing Platform team to architect, design, develop and deploy solutions utilizing the ServiceNow platform. Their deliverables will be focused on development and delivery of value-added integration, out-of-box configuration and consultative services for low code software development. They will collaborate with a team of Engineers to design, deploy and integrate various product capabilities.<p><br></p>Successful execution of delivery on Enterprise Technology Solution epics in-scope for enabling IT Service Management and Security Operations within the ServiceNow platform. This person will provide testing and support for ServiceNow upgrade that we have scheduled in early November, where all functionality has been tested/validated for User Acceptance and any bugs have been fixed. Additionally, Architecture/Designs related to Security Operations and the ITSM in the cloud for our roadmap.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Contribute to design, technical direction, and architecture with various teams to build fit for purpose solutions</li><li>Participates in code reviews, proactively identifying and mitigating potential issues and defects as well as assisting with continuous improvement</li><li>Follows agreed upon SDLC procedures to ensure that all information system products and services meet both explicit and implicit quality standards, end-user functional requirements, architectural standards, performance requirements, audit requirements, security rules are upheld, and external facing reporting is represented</li><li>Writes unit and integration tests to maintain quality technology improvements</li><li>Performs application and project risk analysis and recommends quality improvements</li><li>Manage Production Support on system functionality and provide fixes as required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in implementing ServiceNow or similar platforms for ITSM, SecOps and/or GRC/IRM modules</li><li>3+ years of experience with Javascript</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs and JSON</li><li>Ability to write clean, bug-free code that is easy to understand and easily maintainable</li><li>Strong understanding of CMDB, including importing customer data</li><li>Experience with Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe), Agile/Scrum, and DevSecOps methodologies</li><li>BS degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, similar technical field</li></ul>

title: Linux Engineer / Administration
description: <strong>LOOKING FOR A NEW LABVIEW OPPORTUNITY? </strong><p><br></p>I have the one for YOU!<p><br></p>My client manufactures Electronics and Telematics for the Automotive/Transportation industry. They are looking for a Tenured Test Engineer to help test the Electronics during and post manufacturing. You will be apart of the team that develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit that is built to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws, focusing on manufacturing defects. You will be building a collection of instruments that takes measurements on the products. You will be working with the product designs in that phase to come up with the test requirements and then write the software to implement. You will control the software that you design and write the software to control instrumentation and the unit that we are testing.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to</li></ul><p><br></p>meet product test requirements<p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and</li></ul><p><br></p>other continuous improvement initiatives<p><br></p><ul><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal</li></ul><p><br></p>project stakeholders<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Labview - Top Skill</li><li>C# - Or other Object oriented languages within test and instrumentation</li><li>Test Stand</li><li>SQL or MySQL</li><li>Manufacturing Test</li><li>Test Automation</li><li>Test development/design</li><li>Test procedure</li><li>Hardware</li><li>Debug</li><li>Test Fixture</li><li>Production</li><li>Manufacturing</li><li>Lab</li><li>Validation</li><li>Test plan</li><li>Test engineering</li><li>Electrical</li><li>Test equipment</li><li>Write test scripts</li><li>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, WiFi)</li><li>Automotive is a plus but not required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Employee Perks</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Weekly</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K plans </li><li>Abenity Discount Program </li><li>Udemy Courses</li><li>Work Life Balance </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience Level</u></strong><p><br></p>5+ years experience<p><br></p><strong><u>About Actalent</u></strong><p><br></p>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions.<p><br></p>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Java Developer - Chicago, Illinois (Hybrid)
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>Located in Woodridge, IL manufactures electronics and telematics offerings for the automotive/transportation industry.<p><br></p>They are looking to add a Sr. Test Engineer to help Test Electronics during and post manufacturing.<p><br></p>This team develops manufacturing tests performed on every unit that we build to make sure it is free of manufacturing flaws. Focuses on manufacturing defects. Our means of doing that is to build a collection of instruments that takes measurements on the products. We work w the product designs in that phase to come up with the test requirements and then write the software to implement that. We control the software that we design and write the software to control instrumentation and the unit that we are testing.<p><br></p><ul><li>Quote, Design, and Develop manufacturing test solutions for New Product Introduction</li><li>Develop software (C#, C, and NI TestStand) to control test instruments and Units Under Test in order to</li></ul><p><br></p>meet product test requirements<p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstrate the ability to develop hardware and software for production test solutions</li><li>Experience interpreting MySQL database schema and writing database queries</li><li>Provide ongoing support for existing products related to ECOs, yield issues, reliability improvements, and</li></ul><p><br></p>other continuous improvement initiatives<p><br></p><ul><li>Written and verbal communication skills to effectively communicate with customers, suppliers, and internal</li></ul><p><br></p>project stakeholders<p><br></p><ul><li>Manage project scopes and timelines and coordinate initiatives with Project Managers</li><li>Collaborate with Production Engineers and Supervisors to integrate test systems into the production process</li><li>Analyze test performance data and use production personnel input to drive test improvements opportunities</li><li>Ability to develop and interpret test requirements and identify test equipment required to meet those</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to identify, assess, and resolve hardware and software issues</li><li>Compile and interpret Gage R&amp;R and Cpk studies</li><li>Support Root Cause Analysis of field return issues and implement additional test coverage as needed</li><li>Create documentation describing test design concepts and operator instructions</li><li>Experience related to manufacturing Printed Circuit Board Assemblies</li><li>Participate in peer reviews of test solutions</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Skills</u></strong><p><br></p>Labview, C#, Test Stand, SQL, Manufacturing Test, Test Automation, Test development, Test design, Test procedure, Hardware, Debug, Test Fixture, Production, Manufacturing, Lab, Validation, Test plan, Test engineering, Electrical, Test equipment, Write test scripts<p><br></p><strong><u>Top Skills Details</u></strong><p><br></p>Labview<p><br></p><strong><u>Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>5+ years experience<p><br></p>Labview<p><br></p>Test Stand<p><br></p>Object oriented languages within test and instrumentation -test fixtures/test stands;<p><br></p>SQL or MySQL-don’t need to design schema, but come up with midlevel queries<p><br></p>PLUS<p><br></p>Automotive is a plus not required though.<p><br></p>Experience developing tests for RF or wireless devices (i.e. Cellular, GPS, Bluetooth, Wi-Fi)<p><br></p><strong><u>About title: ServiceNow Solutions Engineer ITSM
description: <strong>McCann Partners is supporting a financial institution in Chicago’s loop by onboarding an <strong>IT Security Engineer (IAM) </strong>for a <strong>12-month contract engagement</strong>. The resource must be onsite two days a week in the Chicago, IL office near Ogilvie Transportation Center and Union Station.<br><br><strong>Position Summary:<br></strong></strong><ul><li>Design, implement, and operate security controls for various Microsoft and Amazon cloud services, primarily focusing on Azure AD.</li><li>Design and implement access control policies within Azure AD and MDM.</li><li>Occasionally provide support off-hours when business-critical problems arise.</li><li>Analyze requirements and apply knowledge of business needs and security risks to determine appropriate action.</li><li>Collaborate with different areas of IT to provide security and business technology solutions for the Bank.</li><li>Development of security policy, standard, procedure, and design documents.</li><li>Design, engineer, and deploy technologies for application integrations using SAML, Open ID, or OAuth</li><li>Act as a point of escalation for issues relating to security controls or tools, including (but not limited to) SSO, MFA, and certificates.</li><li>Occasionally provide support off-hours when business-critical problems arise.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Software Requirements: <br></strong><ul><li>Active Directory (On-Prem)</li><li>Azure Active Directory</li><li>CyberArk (Preferred)</li><li>Windows Servers (2016 and newer)</li><li>Azure B2C (preferred)</li><li>Azure Application Proxy (preferred)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Experience Requirements: <br></strong><ul><li>Five or more years of Azure experience.</li><li>Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell.</li><li>Experience writing documentation ranging from deep technical write-ups to end-user guides.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Education Requirements:<br></strong><ul><li>4-year college degree in Information Technology or equivalent experience.</li><li>Security certifications (CISSP, GSEC, CCSP, etc.) preferred.</li><li>Microsoft 365 certificates preferred.</li><li>Knowledge, Skills, abilities, and behaviors required.</li><li>Ability to work independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision.</li><li>Working knowledge of authentication and authorization protocols.</li><li>Ability to address conflict with peers and others in the organization.</li><li>Strong attention to detail and commitment to delivering quality solutions.</li><li>Knowledge of IT security controls and IT infrastructure, especially IAM processes.</li><li>Outstanding communication skills (verbal, written, visualization). This role requires the ability to communicate difficult concepts clearly and the desire to listen to understand.</li></ul>

title: Telco Cloud Field Engineer
description: <strong>Data Integrity Engineer</strong><p><br></p><strong>100% Remote – Central or East Coast Timezones Only</strong><p><br></p><strong>Summary</strong><p><br></p>We are seeking a Data Quality Engineer to drive quality processes across our BI platform, that is built largely on a Microsoft stack in an Azure environment, leveraging Snowflake as our DW, in addition to Power BI, Databricks, etc.<p><br></p>You’ll conduct data audits and spend a lot of time writing scripts to automate the testing of data.<p><br></p>Many of our data pipelines are built with Python and SQL feeding data into Snowflake – so you’ll need strong experience in these areas.<p><br></p>You’ll be working on Data Quality team of 3, that sits inside our broader data organization of 26.<p><br></p><strong>What You’ll Be Doing</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop data validation test plans and test cases to ensure that business requirements are met.</li><li>Conduct test plans for validation of data mapping. Automate test if and when required to improve data testing process.</li><li>Write test cases in Zephyr Scale to document test plans and coverage.</li><li>Investigate data errors or anomalies, and assisting with the implementation of solutions to rectify such as determining root causes.</li><li>Management of presentation for data quality outputs scoring and data profiling results (i.e., building Power BI dashboards for data quality checks internally).</li><li>Collaborate with rest of data integrity engineers to architect and build solutions to improve data quality.</li><li>Develop and maintain tools, templates, and methodologies to support the execution and implementation of data securities, policies and standards (e.g., work with data teams to ensure personally identifying information isn’t included in data sets, etc.).</li><li>Assist in identifying, automating, and maintaining data quality processes and standards.</li><li>Map new data elements in various applications to ensure data interpretations are maintained as data moves from system(s) to system(s).</li><li>Perform audits on key data elements and deliver data quality metrics to prove data integrity.</li><li>Assist with maintenance of data mapping documentation to maintain and improve data definitions.</li><li>Help us to make better decisions, empower our people, and solve problems.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills We’re Seeking</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience in a technical, data-focused role, which could be Data Engineering, ETL, DW or BI focused engineering role</li><li>Must have strong experience with Data Quality</li><li>Must have strong experience with Test Automation or script development to automate test execution</li><li>Strong experience with SQL</li><li>Strong experience with Python</li><li>Knowledge of basic Data Governance processes</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice To Have Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience with Snowflake</li><li>Zephyr Scale experience</li><li>Experience with Quality Systems including monitoring and Alerts</li><li>Power BI experience</li><li>Experience with Databricks and/or other Azure data services</li><li>DevOps experience, managing Git and/or CI/CD pipelines</li><li>Experience with other tools we use just like ADO, JIRA and DBT</li></ul>

title: ETL Informatica Developer/Architect
description: Job description:<br><br><p>We are looking for a Field Service Engineering to join our growing team. You will be responsible for properly managing customer accounts assigned by providing the hardware/software maintenance of stand-alone Agfa products and/or associated peripheral equipment. Major responsibilities centre on implementing timely, effective installation and repair services as well as ensuring customer satisfaction and the active promotion of all company offerings. Travel up to 90% of the time Monday - Friday<br><br></p><p>This position can be based in Illinois. This position requires travel up to 90% of the time Monday thought Friday travel commitment.<br><br></p><p><strong>Responsibilities:<br><br></strong></p><ul> <li>Responsible for the installation and repair of assigned Agfa products, to include safety verification of electrical and environmental factors at customer site, testing of product to ensure functional operation, verification of operating performance with customer, and review of the basic operational functions with the customer to meet our training obligation at installation.</li> <li>Performs preventive maintenance and repair functions on assigned SMA, courtesy visits as required, and time &amp; material accounts.</li> <li>Maintains regular communications with Regional Manager to provide prompt escalation to difficulties and ensure customer satisfaction.</li> <li>Documents service calls, expenses and time reports on a daily basis and submit to zone office on a weekly basis according to established procedures; documentation must be legible and neat.</li> <li>Responsible for parts ordering and returning repairable spare parts components.</li> <li>Ensures the service ready condition of service aids, tools and diagnostic equipment.</li> <li>Maintains close contact with scheduler to meet all response time and uptime commitments. </li> <li>Promotes all Agfa offerings (i.e. System Maintenance Agreements, Professional Services, Products)</li> <li>Understand and adhere to all safety policies on the job and while driving company vehicle.</li> <li>Quickly ascertain customer demeanour and personality and be able to interact effectively.</li> <li>Engage with other Agfa employees and be able to work effectively with different skill-sets, emotions and motives.</li> <li>Demonstrate company loyalty and consciously make decisions that are fiscally responsible and prudent</li> <li>Be resourceful and creative but work without supervision while staying motivated.</li> <li>Incumbent serves as onsite conduit to Agfa management and Sales for customer issues: sales needs, political environment, staff changes, etc.</li> <li>Product expertise might be limited to similar product lines and customer environments: processors, inkjet, commercial, newspaper.</li> </ul><p><strong>Education:<br><br></strong></p><ul> <li>Minimum of an Associate’s degree in electronics technology or equivalent.</li> </ul><p><strong>Experience:<br><br></strong></p><ul> <li>Minimum 2-3 years’ experience in a high-tech field, printing, publishing, and/or inkjet environment would be a asset.</li> <li>Willingness to travel up to 90% of the time Monday - Friday. </li> </ul><p><strong>Specific skills:<br><br></strong></p><ul> <li>Strong Communication skills both written and verbal</li> <li>Problem Analysis &amp; Judgment</li> <li>Self-awareness and self-motivating</li> <li>Knowledge of the Graphics, Inkjet, Printing/Publishing Market an asset</li> <li>Strong customer service &amp; support principals</li> <li>Experience and understanding of remote diagnostics</li> </ul><p><strong>What we offer now and in the future:<br><br></strong></p><ul> <li>Dynamic global organization with a history of innovation and strong product portfolio.</li> <li>Challenging environment combined with a supportive management structure.</li> <li>Career development and growth.</li> <li>Competitive salary and benefit package.</li> <li>Friendly work environment surrounded by dedicated and professional colleagues.</li> </ul><p>Curious about this opportunity? We also know that a job contains more than just bullets! Apply! We love to tell you more about our company, the content of the function, responsibilities and possibilities. Just apply! Talk Soon.<br><br></p>

title: Test Engineer
description: If you are a current Chamberlain Group employee, please click here to apply through your Workday account.<p><br></p>At Chamberlain Group (CG), we hire smart, creative people to work on next-gen products for a connected world. We are passionate technologists with bold ideas and diverse perspectives. Our Engineering teams—spanning mechanical, firmware, machine learning and AI, cloud, and mobile technologies and more—reinvent access by combining hardware with cutting-edge, cloud-based solutions to create a safer, smarter customer experience. At CG, we encourage flexibility, fun, and a healthy work/life balance, including remote options.<p><br></p>Group is a global leader in access solutions with top brands, such as LiftMaster and Chamberlain, found in millions of homes, businesses, and communities worldwide. As a leader in the Smart Home industry, we boast one of the largest IoT install bases, with innovative products consisting of cameras, locks, card readers, garage door openers, gates and more, all powered by our myQ digital ecosystem.<p><br></p>This role is responsible for applying skilled knowledge of engineering principles and practices in engineering to support NPD, sustaining, and productivity designs that have limited complexity. This role will be heavily involved in developing test procedures, test strategies, outlining test automation initiatives, and some understanding of the principles in reliability testing.<p><br></p><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for creating, maintaining, and executing test plans on hardware and software of Chamberlain products</li><li>Estimating test effort, analyzing, and communicating test results, tracking defects, and participating in gauge R&amp;R studies</li><li>Participates as a key core team member on new product development teams, along with productivity and sustaining projects, attends design reviews, and day-to-day Agile scrum activities</li><li>Works with regulatory engineers to set-up and conduct test plans for UL agency-type testing.</li><li>Prepares and reviews test reports for projects and assists other TEs with their projects.</li><li>Directs the operation of a variety of computer automated and manual test equipment including data acquisition systems, environmental chambers, RF chambers, acoustics chambers, EMC test equipment, electrical test instrumentation, vibration systems, and assorted measurement transducers.</li><li>Evaluates the results of EMC testing of RF emissions, RF sensitivity, radiated and conducted immunity, and RF electrical safety evaluation.</li><li>Participate in defect analysis, root cause analysis, study product functionality impact, and provide key insight of observed product performance and defects.</li><li>Works with Manager to establish new test procedures, testing methodologies, and provides input for custom test fixture design and automation projects.</li><li>Comply with health and safety guidelines and rules; managers should also ensure compliance across their teams</li><li>Protect CGI’s reputation by keeping information confidential</li><li>Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops, professional publications, establishing personal networks, and participating in professional societies</li><li>Contribute to the team effort by accomplishing related results and participating on projects as needed</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Requirements: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in engineering and minimum of three (3) years of job-related experience strongly preferred; or minimum of seven (7) years of job-related experience as defined in the Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities; an advanced degree in directly applicable area of study may substitute for up to two (2) years of experience</li><li>3+ years of job-related experience with Bachelor’s degree in engineering</li><li>Able to travel up to 10% - domestically and internationally</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Job Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>LIMS software experience; Six Sigma Yellow Belt certification; familiarity with general MS Office applications such as Word, Excel, Visio, and Project</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work within cross-functional teams to facilitate the creation of electro-mechanical products; analytical skills to support design creation of electro-mechanical systems by completing calculations involving statics, confidence and reliability testing, technical writing, and laying out Gantt and flow charts; conducting Anova GRR; good presentation skills; strong analytical skills</li></ul><p><br></p>We're an organization who values its human capital and provides support to assist its employees succeed.<p><br></p>Chamberlain Group is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discriminations or harassment.<p><br></p>Persons with disabilities who anticipate needing accommodations for any part of the application process may contact, in confidence Recruiting@Chamberlain.com.<p><br></p>NOTE: Staffing agencies, headhunters, recruiters, and/or placement agencies, please do not contact our hiring managers via email or phone or other methods.

title: Linux Engineer / Middleware
description: <strong>Job#: 1350235<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description:<br><br></strong><strong>Axiom Developer<br><br></strong><strong>Remote<br><br></strong><strong>Contract Opportunity<br><br></strong>For more information contact Myia Augustin at [email protected]<br><br><strong>Contractors Role:</strong> Support 2023 strategic projects. Resource will be playing a key role in some of the development &amp; support activities related to these projects.<br><br><strong>Qualifications;<br></strong><ul><li> Minimum of 6 to 8 years of IT Development experience with minimum of 3 years of Axiom SL controller view development experience is a must.</li><li> Must have the ability to create Axiom objects such As Data Sources, Data Models, Shorthand’s, Portfolios, Aggregations along with other data mapping activities.</li><li> Must have prior experience in mapping and configuring free form reports, tabular reports and automation of Axiom workflows.</li><li> Prior experience on configuring APAC taxonomy reports (Singapore, Australia) and EMEA regulatory reporting initiatives is must.</li><li> Prior experience and knowledge on US regulatory reports is a benefit – FFIEC031, FFIEC041, FFIEC009 etc.,</li><li> Work in the role of an Axiom Developer in a fast-paced environment, must be a self-starter, comfortable dealing with clients, VERY strong communication skills.</li><li> Must have the ability to review project related documents such as BRD, FSD and understand the design and solutions architecture with minimal guidance.</li><li> Hands on development of ETL jobs, Shell scripting and delivering the functionality details in technical specifications.</li><li> Development and review of PL SQL &amp; other DB code to support date sourcing into Axiom.</li><li> Ensuring code written meets the predefined company and departments standards.</li><li> Must have prior performance tuning experience both inside the Axiom controller view as well as at the DB level.</li><li> Preparation and execution of detailed unit test cases.</li><li> Creation of Data Sources, Data Models, Shorthand’s, Portfolios, Aggregations, Fee Form and Tabular Report and workflows using AXIOM controller view tool based on Regulatory report requirements.</li><li> Migration of Axiom components from one environment to another.</li><li> Understanding the Functional documents and work with BA/Users to develop the reports.</li><li> Good experience in Regulatory Reporting and Data Warehousing<br><br></li></ul><strong>Must Have:<br><br></strong>Axiom Developer experience (must have previously developed and not maintained)<br><br><strong>Nice to Haves:<br><br></strong>Past FS experience<br><br><strong>Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li> Configure objects and reports in Axiom<br><br></li></ul>EEO Employer<br><br>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. title: Test Engineer
description: <strong>Role</strong>: Axiom Developer / IT – Application Architect<br><br><strong>Start date</strong>: June<br><br>Contract through April with possibility of FTE conversion<br><br>100% remote or local to Chicago<br><br>Our client, a Chicago based global financial institution, is looking for an Axiom SL Developer to join their team. Exciting opportunity for a candidate who has a strong Axiom background and looking for their next career move.<br><br>The successful candidate will support various projects for the Cash business unit, specifically 2023 GRS NA &amp; GRS EMEA strategic projects. Will play a key role in some of the development &amp; support activities related to these projects. For example, configure objects and reports in Axiom.<br><br><u><strong>Skills – must haves:</strong></u> <ul><li>AXIOM SL – developer (not tester)</li><ul><li>3 years minimum of Axiom SL controller view development experience </li></ul><li>IT development experience (6-8 years minimum) </li><li>Axiom database maintenance </li><li>Code development – develop data models, data sources, objects </li><li>Change management – will support SAT &amp; UAT &amp; into production, post production support, batch processing, and upgrade patches </li><li>Collaboration skills – Work across different teams (QAs and Business teams) </li><li>Experience configuring regulatory reports </li><li>Communication skills </li><li>Strong references <br><br></li></ul><u><strong>Nice to have:<br></strong></u><ul><li>Work in teams internally and with vendors, in the US and India </li><li>Financial services </li><li>Regulatory Reporting &amp; Data Warehousing </li><li>US regulatory reports knowledge / experience – FFIEC031, FFIEC041, FFIEC009 etc. <br><br></li></ul><em>Heitmeyer Consulting is an equal opportunity employer and we encourage all qualified candidates to apply. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to minority status, gender, disability, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.</em>

title: IAM Security Engineer
description: <strong><u>Your Impact: </u></strong><p><br></p>Rauland is looking for a talented and passionate Firmware Engineer who wants to make an impact in the medical &amp; educational space. We are seeking an experienced developer who will help us build and enhance tools and applications that are used by thousands of healthcare providers and patients worldwide for the latest in acute and long-term care facilities and the applications used by the educational institutions.<p><br></p><strong><u> What You'll Do: </u></strong><ul><li> Design and buildout firmware for a new generation of Rauland designed hardware SKUs. </li><li> Participate in all aspects of the software development life cycle from requirements review to product verification. </li><li> Create or review:</li><ul><li> System, sub-system and functional requirements </li><li> Software architecture and detailed design documents </li><li> Software verification plans </li><li> Software build and deployment plans. </li></ul><li> Participate in code inspections. </li><li> Work with the assigned software architect to design and code solutions. </li><li> Work with verification and validation engineers to resolve test failures. </li><li> Work with the technical support group to troubleshoot field problems. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u> Do You Have?... </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or equivalent. </li><li> At least 5 years development experience in design and implementation of multi-task, event-driven real time embedded development. </li><li> Expertise with development tools for revision control, bug tracking, peer code review, etc. </li><li> Linux kernel development and integration </li><li> Low Level driver development </li><li> Integrating board support packages from RTOS vendors </li><li> Excellent knowledge of OS coding techniques, IP protocols, interfaces and hardware subsystems </li><li> Developing firmware using an RTOS </li><li> Integrating hardware and firmware </li><li> Codec programming and integration </li><li> Experience reading schematics and data sheets for components. </li><li> Experience using emulators and hardware debugging tools. </li><li> Experience with IAR Workbench or similar embedded IDEs. </li><li> Excellent verbal and written communication skills are required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u> Why Us? </u></strong><p><br></p>Rauland, a division of AMETEK, is a business unit in the Measurement, Communications and Technologies division of AMETEK. We are a leader in integrated communications technology, designing and manufacturing Nurse Call Systems for the medical industry and school critical communication systems for the education K-12 market.<p><br></p>Website: www.rauland.com<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Salary Minimum: Market<p><br></p>Salary Maximum: Market<p><br></p>Incentive: No<p><br></p>Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.<br><br>AMETEK is committed to making a safer, sustainable, and more productive world a reality. We use differentiated technology solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. We employ 18,500 colleagues, in 30 countries, that are grounded by our core values: Ethics and Integrity, Respect for the Individual, Diversity and Inclusion, Teamwork, and Social Responsibility. AMETEK (NYSE:AME) is a component of the S&amp;P 500. Visit www.ametek.com for more information.<br><br>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call 1 (866) 263-8359.

title: Data Quality Engineer
description: <p><strong>Job Title:&nbsp;React Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location:&nbsp;Chicago, IL – 60606 – Hybrid, once in a week to Willis Tower, Chicago</strong></p><p><strong>Duration: 06+ Month (s) assignment</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Job Descriptions:</strong></p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As a React Developer, you will help lead the modernization of a major American airline client.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;You will be responsible for writing efficient, testable, and reusable code using React and Redux.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are looking for a developer who is passionate about writing the best quality code and has knowledge/experience across multiple technologies. A successful developer in this role will be one who can accurately comprehend business requirements and code creative solutions to satisfy those requirements to deliver on the best experience for our customers.</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This role will be working within an agile team environment building and updating design system components for United.com and leading the way in enhancing the performance and quality of the codebase.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:</strong></p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lead the design, development, and planning for solutions that maintain of a major American airline client technology standards</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Perform code reviews and mentor your peers</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Help to troubleshoot, test, and maintain the product</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Work in an Agile environment</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>REQUIRED:</strong></p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5+ years of experience in software development</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3+ years of expert level Javascript experience with React, Redux, Webpack and ES6 or equivalent experience</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A deep understanding of accessibility fundamentals and its application in creating robust user interfaces</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experience in Source code repositories like Github</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experience with end to end CI/CD solutions using platforms like TeamCity</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Experience with web application testing frameworks like Jest or Enzyme</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Understanding of complex large-scale application architecture</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Demonstrated technical leadership in a web application development team</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Excellent communication and people skills</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field or equivalent experience, education or training</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>PREFERRED:</strong></p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ability to create high level application architecture</p><p>·&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship.</p>

title: Field Service Engineer
description: Pay Rate: Starting at $81 per hour.<p><br></p>Contract Duration: Starting as a 6-month contract.<p><br></p><ul><li> Experience designing and implementing solutions in Oracle Service Bus and/or IBM Datapower</li><li> Able to perform deployments into dev, test, and production environment with appropriate test and post-change validation plans</li><li> Able to work with automation, build, and code management tools (Ansible, WLST/Python, Jenkins, GitHub)</li><li> Experience diagnosing and troubleshooting OSB and Weblogic deployments and connections to other common application stack services (Kafka, ODBC, WebServices) over both 1-way and 2-way SSL connections</li><li> Familiar with team documentation and task management tool (Wiki’s, Jira)</li></ul>

title: React Developer
description: Korn Ferry is seeking a Cloud Engineer for one of our clients in Chicago, IL.<p><br></p>The Onyx Cloud Engineer will be a subject matter/domain expert with specific expertise with AWS at a minimum, requisite for the position to that of a DevOps/GitOps Cloud Engineer, in a hands-on capacity, with working knowledge and understanding centered around the following areas:<p><br></p><ul><li> GitOps, DevOps, and ChatOps principles and best practices</li><li> AWS managed services, included but not limited to EKS, ECR, RDS, KMS, IAM,VPC, Lambda, Route 53, ALB, ELB, Dynamo DB, EC2, S3, SNS, SQS, EBS, Transit Gateway, Direct Connect, network access control list, and security groups</li><li> Kubernetes (EKS preferred)</li><li> Helm Charts/Helm Files</li><li> IaC (Terraform)</li><li> IDP (Azure AD*)</li><li> SEIM</li></ul><p><br></p>* Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Delivery concepts and supporting commercial and OSS tooling, including but not limited Jenkins, Jfrog Artifactory &amp; Xray, SonarQube, Harness*, Spinnaker*, and ArgoCD*<p><br></p><ul><li> Pipeline as Code</li><li> Continuous Observability specific to logging, monitoring, and tracing leveraging OSS tooling such as: Splunk, Dynatrace, Prometheus, Grafana, Fluentd, Kuberhealthy*, and Open Telemetry* as well as AWS managed services such as CloudWatch</li><li> Defines the set of declarative modules for infrastructure provisioning via Terraform Enterprise for the design, build, and implementation of the Onyx Cloud Platform, hosted on AWS</li><li> Drives industry best practices and approaches to implementing infrastructure as code (IaC) specific to Kubernetes infrastructure provisioning</li><li> Actively engages and participates in both internal and external technology forums related to Terraform, Kubernetes and DevOps/GitOps initiatives</li><li> Provides sound recommendations in order to improve and/or implement best practices for supporting Onyx Toolchain strategy and initiatives</li><li> Hands-on keyboard coding required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Korn Ferry</strong><p><br></p>Korn Ferry unleashes potential in people, teams, and organizations. We work with our clients to design optimal organization structures, roles, and responsibilities. We help them hire the right people and advise them on how to reward and motivate their workforce while developing professionals as they navigate and advance their careers. To learn more, please visit Korn Ferry at ;/span&gt;<p><br></p>Experience with AWS (Amazon Web Services) &amp; Microsoft Azure - Advanced

title: Engineer 3, Test
description: <strong>C# Backend Developer - Contract</strong><p><br></p>Rate: Open within reason<p><br></p>Duration: minimum one year<p><br></p>LOCATION: Chicago, IL - must be local to come in the office during the week<p><br></p>They are going from angular UI to blazor UI by Microsoft. Looking for C# fullstack developer with heavy angular.<p><br></p><strong><u>Job Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>You must have a strong understanding of object-oriented analysis and design and the agile software development process, solid coding and debugging skills, and a passion for contributing in a group environment.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Following Specific Skills Are Required For This Role</u></strong><p><br></p>Proficiency in C#<p><br></p>Experience using git<p><br></p>Experience doing test-first development with continuous integration<p><br></p>Experience doing both Front End and Back End web development with REST APIs<p><br></p>Proficiency in at least at least one modern SPA framework like React, Angular, etc.<p><br></p>Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript<p><br></p>Experience using SQL<p><br></p>Working knowledge of Blazor preferred

title: Axiom Developer
description: <ul><li>Vast growth opportunities, long retention, up to 20% bonuses|Opportunity with company exponentially accelerating revenue and overall growth<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>My client is a industry leader in the customer loyalty space. The leadership within the company is constantly finding new ways to adapt to market changes and opportunities in the sports market for youth athletes and thier families. In order to do so, they are in need of smart, self-sufficient, and accountable software engineers excelling in problem-solving. My client is planning on staying agile and flexible in regards to strategies and best practices. Staying up to date on current trends as well as paving the way to new ones will be essential in this role.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Autonomy on project implementation</li><li>Gamifying marketing strategies for clients</li><li>Efficient in coding review</li><li>Reporting directly to owners</li><li>Agile work-flow </li><li>Collaborating with leadership onshore and offshore<br><br></li></ul>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Must live in or be willing to commute to Chicago</li><li>Full stack coding experience in C# and .NET frameworks (5-7 years).</li><li>Good communication skill.</li><li>Loves building things and working in a team.</li><li>Eager to move into a lead role with rapid expected company growth.</li><li>Comfortable working in a remote role.</li><li>Dependable individual who can take initiative on cleaning up and expanding projects.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Salary based on experience and interviews</li><li>Expected company growth</li><li>Growth in individual role in short and long-term</li><li>Innovative projects</li><li>Reporting directly to VP of Software Development</li><li>Autonomy on projects</li><li>Great culture focused on building a self-driven team</li><li>Full medical, dental, vision</li><li>Generous PTO</li><li>Strong employee benefits and perks<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Sean Stanton<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6061317</strong>

title: Cloud Automation Developer
description: <em>An empty treadmill isn’t compelling, but once someone steps on it, the stories are limitless. Our goal is to connect people emotionally to their fitness journey. We are a global team coming from different cultures and backgrounds with a shared passion to achieve and live our mission of inspiring healthier lives. <br><br></em><em>Inspire. Innovate. Make an impact and join our team!<br><br></em>Our <strong>Embedded Software Engineer</strong> is responsible for the performance of professional work in research, development, design, testing, analysis, production, construction, maintenance, or operation of company product lines. Significant latitude is given to work within the team to develop superior designs and innovative solutions as well as improve the development processes.<br><br><strong><u>Primary Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Works closely with Product Management to collaborate on requirements and recommended implementations.</li><li>Participates as a key functional team member as part of the integrated project team.</li><li>Designs and codes software to meet requirements.</li><li>Follows industry standard practices of conducting design reviews, code walk throughs, unit level testing, and integration testing.</li><li>Works closely with the Software Quality Assurance team to test, troubleshoot, resolve, and release production software.</li><li>Ensures prompt response to production and customer issues.</li><li>Applies intensive and diversified knowledge of engineering principles in broad areas of assignments and related fields.</li><li>Assists in interpreting, organizing, executing, and coordinating assignments.</li><li>Supports the development of engineering projects concerned with unique or challenging designs which have an important effect on major company initiatives.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong><strong><em>Required Skills<br></em></strong><ul><li>Strong understanding of software design, methods, and architecture approaches</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering principles</li><li>Experience with C/C++ software development</li><li>Experience developing using embedded Linux; Ability to effectively navigate and work in a Yocto Linux target environment preferred</li><li>Capable of using git for software version control.</li><li>Able to write and maintain unit tests using Google Test/Mock preferred</li><li>Knowledge of kernel interfaces at a userspace level and interacting with Linux kernel drivers preferred</li><li>Confident team player motivated by a fast-paced environment</li><li>Operate efficiently within Agile/Scrum based SW development<br></li></ul><strong><em>Education<br></em></strong><ul><li>Minimum B.S. in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related discipline<br></li></ul><strong><u>Additional Preferred Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Experience with volts-hertz induction motor experience</li><li>Familiarity with Jira and Jenkins.</li><li>Understanding of what a BSP is, how it applies to a development process, and what goes into managing one.</li><li>Strong understanding of software design patterns and how, why, and when to apply them.</li><li>Ability to learn existing architecture quickly.</li><li>Experience developing within RTOS using C and C++.</li><li>Experience in Python and shell.<br></li></ul>Want to take the next step in your career?<br><br>Life Fitness takes pride in our talented employees and believe in providing opportunities for further growth and advancement. We encourage you to test your strengths, push your limits and unleash your potential.<br><br>If you feel the open position you see is right for you, we invite you to apply.<br><br><em>Learn more about us here.<br><br></em><em>Life Fitness does not accept applications, inquiries or solicitations from unapproved staffing agencies or vendors.<br><br></em>Equal Opportunity Employer: Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled<br><br>EEO is The Law - click here for more information<br><br>Life Fitness and Workday Privacy Policies

title: Visual Cobol Developer
description: This is a hybrid position (once a week) and the candidate must either be a US Citizen or Green Card holder.<p><br></p>The candidate will need to provide their LinkedIn link on the resume.<p><br></p><strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p>As a React Developer, you will help lead the modernization of Client.com.<p><br></p>You will be responsible for writing efficient, testable, and reusable code using React and Redux.<p><br></p>We are looking for a developer who is passionate about writing the best quality code and has knowledge/experience across multiple technologies. A successful developer in this role will be one who can accurately comprehend business requirements and code creative solutions to satisfy those requirements to deliver on the best experience for our customers.<p><br></p>This role will be working within an agile team environment building and updating design system components for Client.com and leading the way in enhancing the performance and quality of the codebase.<p><br></p><strong><u>Heres What Youll Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p>" Lead the design, development, and planning for solutions that maintain Clients technology standards<p><br></p>" Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges<p><br></p>" Perform code reviews and mentor your peers<p><br></p>" Help to troubleshoot, test, and maintain the product<p><br></p>" Work in an Agile environment<p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p>" 5+ years of experience in software development<p><br></p>" 3+ years of expert level JavaScript experience with React, Redux, Webpack and ES6 or equivalent experience<p><br></p>" A deep understanding of accessibility fundamentals and its application in creating robust user interfaces<p><br></p>" Experience in Source code repositories like Github<p><br></p>" Experience with end to end CI/CD solutions using platforms like TeamCity<p><br></p>" Experience with web application testing frameworks like Jest or Enzyme<p><br></p>" Understanding of complex large-scale application architecture<p><br></p>" Demonstrated technical leadership in a web application development team<p><br></p>" Excellent communication and people skills<p><br></p>" BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field or equivalent experience, education or training<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p>" Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming<p><br></p>" Ability to create high level application architecture

title: Experience with AWS (Amazon Web Services) & Microsoft Azure - Advanced
description: Take your career to the next level as an embedded software engineer, using your expertise in embedded C and MATLAB/Simulink to develop advanced features for the off-highway autonomous vehicle industry and push the technology of flagship vehicles such as tractors, harvesters, combines, and excavators to the next level.<br><ul><li>Your Responsibilities:*</li><li>Design, develop, and test software for enterprise programming and infrastructure solutions</li><li>Operate in a scrum team environment on varying project scope and direction from a project lead</li><li>Support the team with concept, development and testing of solutions</li><li>Software:*</li><li>Embedded C/C++</li><li>MATLAB/Simulink</li><li>Qualifications:*</li><li>Demonstrated capability in software product development using C++, C, Python and scripting languages</li><li>Training or experience with Object-Oriented Analysis/Design (OOA/D) and multi-threaded systems</li><li>Experience that demonstrates you are a self-starter, and able to work well without close direction</li><li>Demonstrated capability performing in an engineering team environment and interfacing with engineers and personnel of other disciplines</li><li>Minimum of 2 years of software industry experience<br><br></li></ul>About Actalent:<br><br>Actalent connects passion with purpose. Our scalable talent solutions and services capabilities drive value and results and provide the expertise to help our customers achieve more. Every day, our experts around the globe are making an impact. We’re supporting critical initiatives in engineering and sciences that advance how companies serve the world. Actalent promotes consultant care and engagement through experiences that enable continuous development. Our people are the difference. Actalent is an operating company of Allegis Group, the global leader in talent solutions. The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: C# Backend Developer w/Angular
description: We seek a react front-end developer to join Mobomo. The group is a team of researchers and engineers who create modeling and simulation software for fuel cells, batteries, solar arrays, and other emerging energy technologies. Customers across the DoD use our software to solve existing energy management and logistics problems and analyze novel modes of use.<br><br><strong><u>Primary Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Implement new user interface features</li><li>Work with other team members to recommend software solutions</li><li>Prepare and run tests</li><li>Contribute to product documentation<br></li></ul><strong><u>Secondary Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>Present work at reviews by sponsors and collaborators.<br><br><strong><u>Required Qualifications</u></strong><ul><li>Skills &amp; Experience</li><ul><li>2+ years in front-end development in a small team-based environment</li><li>2+ years with the React and Redux front-end framework</li><li>JavaScript front-end tools such as yarn, react-scripts, and webpack.</li><li>Front end unit and integration tests in Jest</li><li>Git and hosted git services such as github/gitlab/bitbucket</li><li>Experience working with Mapping API's (e.g. Google Maps, ESRI, OpenStreet Maps)</li></ul><li>Ability to successfully complete a security clearance process - Must be a US citizen </li><li>B.S. degree in scientific or technical field<br></li></ul><strong><u>Desired Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>Experience designing user interfaces to explain physical systems and simulations<br><ul><li>Typescript </li><li>Demonstrated knowledge of advanced Git concepts</li><li>Experience developing components in a component explorer like storybook.js or styleguidist</li><li>Strong preference of an active secuirty clearance <br></li></ul>Key Words: Front-end, Redux, React, HTML, CSS,<br><br><strong><u>About Mobomo<br><br></u></strong>Mobomo is a full-service DevOps agency dedicated to creating elegant solutions to solve complex problems.<br><br>Mobomo benefits include health care, paid time off, retirement savings and professional development.<br><br>Mobomo is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, citizenship status, veteran status, disability status or any other basis as protected by federal state, or local law.<br><br>Powered by JazzHR

title: Software Engineer C#/.NET
description: <strong><u>Overview<br><br></u></strong>Tekwissen group is a workforce management provider throughout the USA and many other countries in the world. This Client is one of the leading providers of Information and Communication Technology (ICT) to service providers. title: CNC Programmer
description: Amtex Systems Inc is an information technology and talent solutions company offering talent and BI consulting to the companies in US for over 20 years.<br><br>Our solutions are designed to fill resource gaps, by providing the right candidates who deliver value to the organization. Our propensity to nurture and build strong relationships with our clients helps us better understand their business demands and gives us the ability to provide services that are on time and rise above the rest.<br><br><strong>Java Developer with AWS<br><br></strong><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago IL, Hybrid 2-3 days a week.<br><br><strong>Duration:</strong>Longterm<br><ul><li>Experienced Java developer with strong analytical skills and ability to translate business problem to technical solution -- "go-getter " mentality who is eager to learn/expand knowledge and will proactively explore and anlayze new approaches to increase efficiencies.</li><li>Experience in dealing with non-functional and scaling issues.</li><li>Experience with developing in AWS environment and using AWS native tools like Lambda, S3, ECS.</li><li>Experience in integrating with systems using REST, SOAP, MQ.</li><li>Experience in data formats like XML, JSON.</li><li>Experiences in writing simulators, unit testing and testing API using tools like Postman, SoapUI.</li><li>Experience in Finance &amp; Payments Domain is a plus</li><li>Ability to conceive and write detailed software implementations/code while ensuring that their code/configurations adhere to the security, logging, error handling, and performance standards and non-functional requirements.</li><li>Ability write, configure, and integratecode to create the software that aligns with architecture patterns and technology strategy.</li><li>Any experience with Business Rules Management Systems (i.e. Drools) is a plus.<br></li></ul>Regards,<br><br>Puneet.

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: CNH Industrial is a world-class equipment and services company dedicated to advancing the noble work of agriculture and construction workers. Driven by our shared purpose of Breaking New Ground, we’re passionate about bringing Innovation, Sustainability, and Productivity to all that we do. As a truly global company, CNH Industrial’s 37,000+ employees form part of a diverse and inclusive workplace, focused on empowering customers to grow, and build, a better world through our core brands: Case IH, STEYR, New Holland Agriculture, CASE, and New Holland Construction.<p><br></p><strong> Software and Electrical Engineers </strong> at CNH Industrial are a key part of <strong> multi-national </strong> teams responsible for the sustainable design, development, validation and delivery of <strong> world- class </strong> <strong>agricultural and construction</strong> equipment that <strong>feeds and shelters</strong> the world's ever growing population.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><strong> What to expect in the position: </strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li> Development of innovative control, digital and power distribution solutions for challenging multidimensional problems. </li><li> Create, monitor, and implement project plans ensuring timely delivery of corporate objectives </li><li> Collaborative creation and execution of validation activities supporting verification of robust designs. </li><li> Interactive working with diverse multi-functional teams and industry leading experts in a global environment. </li><li> Opportunity to bring designs to life <br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong> What to expect from </strong> <strong>CN</strong><strong>H Industrial:</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li> Exposure to diverse and international cultures </li><li> Flexible and dynamic work environment </li><li> Direct customer engagement </li><li> Industry leading 401K, holiday shutdown &amp; bonus potential </li><li> A career journey with endless possibilities <br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Wide range of opportunities</strong> Available at nationwide locations such as:<p><br><br></p><ul><li> Benson, MN </li><li> Burr Ridge, IL </li><li> Casa Grande, AZ </li><li> Fargo, ND </li><li> Goodfield, IL </li><li> Mt Vernon, IN </li><li> New Holland, PA </li><li> St Nazianz, WI <br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Do you have what it takes?</strong><p><br><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor of Science or greater in electrical, software, systems or related engineering subject area. </li><li> Off-Highway equipment and automotive interest or knowledge </li><li> Proficiency in Simulink, CAPITAL, Creo cabling (or similar tools), CAN and LIN network protocols, Problem Solving, R&amp;D, etc. </li><li> Ability to travel both domestically and internationally as the need arises. <br></li></ul><p><br></p>Our Software and Electrical Engineer team have flexible <strong>HYBRID</strong> work arrangements.<p><br></p><strong>Company Benefits</strong><p><br></p>CNH Industrial offers a wide variety of benefits that not only encourages wellness and preventive care, but we also provide the right tools and programs to help you achieve it. Our benefits package includes medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Our industry leading 401k will support you in meeting your retirement objectives. Additional benefits include paid parental leave, flexible work policies, opportunities for self-development and paid leave for specific activities. Click here for more information!<p><br></p><strong> EEO </strong><p><br></p>US applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. Applicants can learn more about their rights by viewing the federal "EEO is the Law" poster and its supplement here . CNH Industrial participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. You can view additional information here.<p><br></p>If you need reasonable accommodation with the application process, please call 1-800-889-4422 option 1 and then option 5, or contact us at narecruitingmailbox@cnhind.com.<p><br></p>Read about our company’s commitment to pay transparency by clicking this link: pay transparency notice .<p><br></p>Canada applicants: CNH Industrial is an equal opportunity employer. This company considers candidates regardless of race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, nationality, place of origin, disability, marital status, family status, age, or any other ground prohibited by applicable provincial human rights legislation.

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: Job:<p><br></p>Senior Site Reliability Engineer (DevOps)<p><br></p>We are looking for a Senior SRE to join our technology team to solve exciting business problems in the domain of commercial banking, and financial services. Candidates must have a strong curiosity for data and a proven track record of successfully implementing AWS solutions with proficiency in software engineering. This is a unique opportunity to apply your skills and have a direct impact on a global business.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of AWS solutions, Java, Python, and data applications. They should also have strong software engineering skills and the ability to build systems that reach very large Enterprise scale.<p><br></p>What You'll Do:<p><br></p><ul><li>Maintain stability of transactions, and troubleshoot middleware, server, load balancer, application, network, database issues on all the environments.</li><li>Provide operational support for systems and maintain software applications including software upgrades to support production operations.</li><li>Debug issues in the production environment through analyzing logs, collection metrics, and leveraging app-monitoring tools, and create solutions for sustained resiliency.</li><li>Partner with application development teams to understand new projects, cross-pipeline requirements, and set Production support team expectations</li><li>Develop end-to-end CI/CD ML pipelines to deploy the knowledge graphs and associated processes</li><li>Minimize manual involvement for the team by driving solutions in automation and implementing continuous improvements that creates a more stable operating environment, including development &amp; configuration for dynamic monitoring, alerting &amp; recovery.</li><li>Build infrastructure as code processes to have a fully resilient and performant environment on AWS </li></ul><p><br></p>Basic Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Required: 5+ years working in a SRE/DevOps engineering role</li><li>Experience with at least 1 high-level programming language (Java, Python, etc)</li><li>Experience with setting up and managing GitHub and using GitHub Actions</li><li>Experience with setting up CI/CD pipelines for building and deploying microservice based applications</li><li>Expertise in build and deploy tools such as (Jenkins, CircleCI, Bamboo, Harness)</li><li>Experience with infrastructure as code (Terraform, Ansible, Helm)</li><li>Experience with infrastructure components such as routers, load balancers, cloud products, container systems, compute, storage and networks</li><li>Experience setting up and managing Kubernetes (or similar) clusters</li><li>Knowledge of deploying to and running on Cloud providers: AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure</li><li>Excellent debugging and trouble shooting skills</li></ul>

title: React Developer III
description: A university is looking for a full-stack Sitecore developer to come in and build out editable Sitecore applications for there customers to use. The ideal candidate would have 3+ years of experience with Sitecore, C# and .NET and front end experience with JavaScript or jQuery.<p><br></p><strong>Required Skills &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Sitecore </li><li>C# </li><li>.NET or .NET Core </li><li>JavaScript (React, Angular, Vue) or jQuery </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desired Skills &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Great communication </li><li>Team player </li><li>Independent coder </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Will Be Doing</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Working on developing editable Sitecore apps </li><li>Responsive web apps </li></ul> The Offer<p><br></p><ul><li>Discount on classes </li><li>37.5 working hours a week </li><li>Health, Dental, Vision Plans </li></ul><p><br></p>Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis now and in the future. FullStack SiteCore Developer
